His lectures are great and he is very clearly passionate about his job. He is funny and approachable. Overall, just a great guy and a great professor.

A really great professor with a great sense of humor. Extremely knowledgable and enthusiastic about his field and is always willing to help students understand material. Very intimidating in the first couple weeks but the exams are easy and the papers are time consuming but also easy. Highly recommend.

Villa's class was horrible. Boring, mostly felt useless, and insane amounts of detailed readings to write papers that answer complex prompts and are graded by TA's who are all looking for different things. TA's grade everything and you never know what you should be focusing on for the papers or final. Great 50 minutes to get other work done.

I genuinely hoped I would get hit by a car every time I had to walk to this class. Grades are made arbitrarily by TA's so pray you get a reasonable one. No Canvas page so you have no idea what you have in the class until the end of the semester. Do not under any circumstances take this class.

Great lecturer and very knowledgable, but the class is so unorganized- essay prompts are ridiculously complex, especially for a 5-page paper, and essays are all graded by TAs with zero rubrics provided so what the TA's are looking for individually ends up being a learning curve, which is difficult when there's only 3 papers the whole semester

The professor literally rambles and rambles the entire lecture for every single class. He has thousands of words on the slides and legit reads straight off of them. He does not look at a single paper. He has your TA from your discussion group grade them. This was bad because certain TAs are looking for completely different things. Would not take
Best Professor I had at ND. His lectures are amazing and his essays are used to make sure you understand the readings. Definitely take his class if possible! Strongly recommend.
Lectures are not engaging or exciting, so you are tempted to miss class often.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Graded by few things

comment: Villa is a very brilliant lecturer and does a good job helping you to understand the challenging content and is available outside of class. Your grade will come from the TA, though, so if you're just filling the theory req of polisci major, I'd recommend an intro course instead so you don't get a bad grade if its not what you want to specialize in.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Villa is really great. For a political science major that doesn't like political theory, his intro class definitely made the subject less painful for me. He's a very eloquent lecturer and extremely knowledgable. Your papers get graded by your TA though, so your grade really comes down to them. He also definitely leans to the left.

He is a relic from the 70s witty and loquacious Internationally renowned scholar on Hannah Arendt I would highly recommend participating in lecture He's a great one - I felt like a real life college student in his class You should definitely take at least one class with this guy
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Funny and brilliant.
smart and shows interesting films.
very smart
The course is very well structured and Professor Parise is a very good communicator. He explains what is necessary from the course content and gives really good notes in class.
Best science professor I've ever had.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: He is really organized and his lectures are easy to follow, which is very helpful for ochem.
Organic Chemistry is obviously a difficult subject, but he was a great professor and genuinely cared about his students succeeding. His lectures provided great notes for studying.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures--Tests are tough

comment: Fantastic teacher. Really invests in students and makes an incredible effort to make organic chemistry accessible and clear.

Outstanding professor. Teaches a hard subject-- organic chemistry, but if you find yourself forced to take the class, he is without a doubt the professor you want for it. No other professor comes close in terms of understanding and explaining things, in addition to actually having written the actual textbook. He's the man.
Parise is a very good professor in a very tough class. The required book is really helpful if you read it. He is very available outside of class if you choose to go to him.
Definitely would recommend Parise for Orgo 1 and 2. His notes are super organized and he explains things really well.

Dr. Parise is an excellent professor who lectures clearly and has great notes.  He holds reviews after every lecture to help you stay on top of the material.  Even so, Orgo (esp 2) is a difficult class and will most likely be a struggle keeping up.  Just stick with it and appreciate his occasional jokes in class, because he's overall adorable!

This man will make you love Orgo. His notes are clear and he is available after class. His tests are hard, but if you "work on problems from the book" you should be fine. He is also a great person to get to know, something that might come in handy when it comes time to get letters of recommendation.
I don't recommend him.  He's this grumpy white dude that has been grumpier than ever.  His dream babysitter, named after a fungus, left him.  Now he has to settle for his biological family.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Super smart guy, but the workload is ridiculous. Would not recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: He's amiable and approachable, yet a strict grader with unattainable expectations. The sheer volume of homework he assigns is overwhelming. Balancing his demands with other coursework and responsibilities is a struggle. While I appreciate his dedication to academic excellence, I wish he would be more mindful of his students' time and workload.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Professor Gregory is outstanding at teaching. A true and passionate scholar, his classes are entertaining and he's usually available to answer any questions. Lots of reading, and papers are harshly graded, but he truly pushes you to your limit (in the best way possible). Would definitely recommend if you're up for a challenge.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Cares about his students and tries his best to get to know everyone. Very knowledgeable and really enjoys what he teaches. Lectures are interesting but can be convoluted. Lots of reading each week for discussion. The tests are pretty straightforward however there is a lot of information covered and they are graded fairly strictly.

Professor Gregory may be the most intelligent professor I've had. His lectures are very detailed and intentionally constructed, and you have to pay close attention to them to be successful. The assessments, however, were very clear in terms of requirements. Doing well in this class is very dependent on simply how much work you're willing to put in.

Honestly my favorite professor I had this semester. So kind and clearly LOVES his subject. However, don't schedule classes right after his lectures because he tends to run about five minutes over. Lots of reading but it's only for discussion posts, and we only have 2-3 tests and papers. Great guy and fun to listen to.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Accessible outside class

comment: Easily the greatest professor I have had at Notre Dame. There is an absurd amount amount of reading (can be upwards of 200 pages a week), but he is a fantastic lecturer and facilitates very insightful discussions. This class is a lot of work, but it is life changing.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Best lecturer that I have ever had. Super helpful. Tons of reading, but by far favorite class I have had. Incredibly helpful and understanding with due dates and student conflicts

I took his Christianity, Commerce, and Consumerism class. By far the best lecturer I have ever had; very knowledgeable about his subject. His class requires a LOT of work. You have at least 100 pages of primary-source reading a week and have to read three books. His class is really only graded on two very hard midterms and two lengthy papers.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Class is a lot of work especially if you have no background in coding in Python. There are LONG homework assignments due every Sunday, and the grading TAs are not the same as the TAs that hold office hours. Lots of readings on Perusall in the beginning. Otherwise easy A if you do the busywork, and exams are not difficult.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: Truly incredible and so inspiring to girls in computer science and tech related fields. She really cares about your individual learning and is available for help, just ask for it! People tend to say she goes too fast or grades harsh, but those are also the people that don't pay attention or engage in class. Pay attention and you'll  do great!

Professor Kumar is really great. She does give a decent amount of homework, as there usually is not enough time to cover the "participation" assignments in class so that must be done before the next class along with the homework. In class she generally programs for the entire time as she explains all of the examples. She's very caring and flexible.

Shreya is one of the worst professors I have ever had. Spends way too much time going over useless concepts, and does a terrible job of explaining difficult topics. Shreya gives little to no resources for exams, and frequently laughs while explaining how hard the tests are going to be. Overall, make sure to avoid Shreya at all costs.

Attendance is 10% of your grade, which stinks because you learn nothing from lecture. Overall the class is fine (for paradigms) and an easy A because it's homework and the tests were open note online (maybe just bc covid tho), but I exclusively learned from doing the homework and just zoned out in class.

Dr. Kumar is SO intelligent and experienced in her work and you can clearly tell in the way she helps her students and the assigned work she has you do. The projects and homeworks she assigns help you understand the course material soo well if you enjoy the topics, plus she's an incredibly inspirational person all around and really easy to talk to
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: She did her best, I think, but her lectures were boring and not particularly helpful. Her homework and project assignment documents weren't particularly clear. Overall, not a *bad* professor, but wouldn't take her again if it can be avoided.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Shreya is da goat!!! Great professor who truly goes out of her way to engage with her students on an individual basis. Her clarity is top-notch, too!

I agree strongly with the other review for this class. I'll add that she gave a "take-home" final exam that was pretty much straight essay questions, and she had the nerve to say it could be finished in class time. I've had arts/letters essay exams that took less time - people have other classes they have to attend while trying to finish it.

Actually one of the worst classes and worst professors I've ever had. I strongly felt the need to register her onto RateMyProfessors just to give her this review. I genuinely don't understand how she is still teaching sometimes. Her lectures can be found online sometimes and she is absolutely awful at explaining even the simplest concepts.

Prof. James was a great Writing and Rhetoric Prof, always being clear about deadlines and expectations. She's very down to earth, extremely understanding, and cares about you as a student. As long as you participate in class, you should be able to cruise with an A.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Projects are long but you have so much freedom in how you approach them that it is still somewhat enjoyable. Her feedback is thoughtful and concise, and you get a few days where all you do is spend fifteen minutes on zoom and then you have the class off. Just pick a fun topic to research.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Very boring class, but she is very nice and she cares about her students. Very easy to get an A.

Prof James was great for Multimedia Writing & Rhetoric. Cares about students and makes it pretty easy to get good grades. Lots of completion points. One major paper that you can revise after feedback and two other big projects are basically the whole class work-wise, so pretty easy workload.

Take her for multimedia writing and rhetoric! Her class has three large assignments and several smaller ones, but very manageable, if you put a fair amount of work in, you will definitely receive an A.
She cares about her students and wants them to succeed. She is a great teacher would definitely recommend taking her.
Great overall class structure, caring and accessible outside of class. Easy A if you put in the work.
Very chill professor and genuinely cares about students. Lets you write about really anything that you want. Would definitely recommend for multimedia w&r

Class was very easy for a writing and rhetoric. Only project that really took a while was the research paper (7-10 pages). Other than that, homework was completion-based and other projects were easily graded and easy to complete. Would recommend taking multimedia for an easy W+R, especially Whitney's.

I loved having Professor James; she is very enthusiastic and willing to provide help with assignments. It is also evident that she genuinely cares for her students. Assignments are clearly laid out and deadlines are manageable.

O'Brien is THE MAN.  He cares about his students and has a great sense of humor.  We start class with a prayer every class and I got to like that.  O'Brien learns every student's name and where they are from and often learns about their families.  He gave me a ride to the airport once when my car wouldn't start and he saw me in the parking lot!
Great dude. Take his class.

Professor O'Brien is quite engaging and uses a lot of real world examples to help students learn.  He learns every student's name and honestly cares for each student.  His exams are tough but if you come to class and pay attention you will learn what you need to learn.  I recommend O'Brien for his other classes too - he also teaches tax.

Professor O’Brien, is hands down the best professor to teach Business Law to a freshman! Since it is about law there is a lot of reading and memorization down the line, but he makes the class interesting, and gives out funny but clear examples for cases. Personally, if he had a class at night, I would take it!

O’Brien starts class with a prayer - nice touch. He loves Notre Dame and it shows. And he is not only apart as hell but cares that students learn from class. He will email or call you if you miss class to make sure you are ok and you will feel bad and not skip again!

Professor O'Brien is wonderful. Very responsive and cares deeply for his students. Every class starts in prayer, and he's willing to answer questions until you understand the material. I would take his class again 100 times over.
rating_tags: Respected--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: Professor O'Brien is a very good man. He starts class with a prayer (I thought it was corny at first but am glad we did that every class). O'Brien learns everyones name and calls on a lot of people. He wants you to learn and he will make sure you come to class and learn. I missed a class and he emailed me to ask if I was sick. He ROCKS!!!!

O'Brien is a good professor. He makes lots of jokes to make class more enjoyable. There are around 7 "pop quizzes", but he normally gives a warning the class before. O'Brien is very knowledgable and passionate about law, and it is clear he wants to share this passion with his students. His tests are pretty fair and on the easier side.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Amazing professor.  Learns all the students' names and really wants to help you learn.  He is the best professor I have ever had.  He has great jokes and will take as much time as necessary to explain issues to you.  TAKE HIS CLASS.
He's awesome
Best professor at Notre Dame. He's the main reason I switched majors to Anthropology.

Professor McKenna is my favorite professor I've ever had at Notre Dame.  He is extremely kind and caring for the students. Entire grade was based off of 6 papers and nothing else, and he's very flexible and willing to change due dates if it seems like the students need more time. Pretty easy grader and his lectures in class were always interesting.

I had Professor McKenna as my University Seminar instructor. His passion for the subject alone made Anthropology one of my favorite classes. His lectures are extremely interesting, and we are only graded on the essays we write on the 6 amazing books read throughout the semester. As long as you demonstrated you read the book and made connections: A.
He is really interested in what he teaches. I was in a small class, which was great because we had interesting conversations a lot of the time rather than lectures every class.

Professor McKenna is one of the most amazing human beings you will ever encounter. I had the flu and pink eye for finals week and the week prior. He gave me hefty extensions and continually checked in on my health, even offering to bring any food or items I may need. He is genuinely interested in the well being and enlightening of his students.

Professor McKenna is easily among the greatest university professors in the field today. He cares for his students, has a clear passion for his chosen discipline, and has great communication skills. If you ever have the chance to take a class with him, you would be well advised to do so. He absolutely influenced my entire life and career.
One of the best professors at ND - take any of his classes, you won't regret it.
He is awesome!
Absolutely the nicest and best teacher at ND.  I've never had a teacher who cares more for students.  I still keep in touch with him.  Take his class, no matter what he's teaching.

Prof. Reynolds is super nice and he does a good job of making the class doable. Attendance is mandatory but it is not bad. If you prepare for assessments (midterm, in-class essay, and final), you will get at least a B, but honestly better. He does not play games with assessments.

He is a good guy, easy going. The class is basically just him talking the whole time and referencing the slides. The slides are based mostly on the reading that was to be done by that class. The tests are pretty fair and not too overboard and the homework are easy. Would say that this class is one you should take

Had Prof. Reynolds for Islam & Christian Theo. He is super knowledgeable and makes an effort to know everyone's name. Very good at introducing new concepts and being mindful of his Christian & Muslim audience. He does get off topic sometimes during lectures but the workload was very manageable and tests were curved. Readings are required but doable

Had him for Islam & Christian Theology. He did a great job introducing unfamiliar concepts and had interesting lectures. Grade is based on a midterm and a final, a research paper, a video assignment, and in class/Perusall participation. Workload was never ridiculous and he was always accessible for help and feedback.

He cares about punctuality and is an interesting lecturer. He will often joke that he talks too much, but he tells you everything you might need to know. The slides don't have all the information, so make sure to take notes in class. He is extremely kind, and when you speak to him, he really listens. Always has a smile while lecturing.

Given that 2 semesters of theology is a requirement at Notre Dame, you would expect that the courses would not have a heavy workload. This is absolutely not the case with Gabriel Reynold's class. Be prepared to read a lot and overall put in a ton of work to get a decent grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Engaging, fair, and somewhat enigmatic.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: Do not take a class taught by Gabriel Reynolds. Period. Participation grades are layups but exams are ridiculous, as in know the speaker and book of the Bible for any quote from any passage read the entire semester and get random details (ostrich's, really?). He rectified this by lifting everyone's grades at the end but there's no transparency.
200 word responses due every class - readings are never super long. two papers and one exam. all around great prof for foundations!!!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Very good Professor at UNLV. He discussed each philosophical topic in detail. He summarizes the readings and also adds more example to let students really grasp the concept. Overall, it was a very interesting class. The two essays though are challenging and involves a lot of thinking time to gather support.

Ramsey was a very good teacher. Took him for my first semester Fall 2013. I will be honest: he is NOT easy, BUT if you go to class and actively participate in discussion, you should be fine. He loves to banter with anyone who is willing to voice their opinion. He is a great! NOTE: He is now located at UNLV (University of Nevada, Las Vegas).
Great, great professor
Prof. Ramsey is one of the best professors I've ever had.  He taught me basic philosophy, got me interested enough to major, and even wrote a recommendation for my Marine Corps commissioning program.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

Galvin is an incredibly kind human being and I was going through a mental health crisis the semester I was in his class (that I never told him about) and I did get my worst college grade in his class. That said, he's a great lecturer and wants to make sure students are understanding the material. I love his accent and he's just a positive, good guy
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Hardest and most time-intensive course I'm taken, but if you have to take honors calc 1 and 2, you're gonna wanna take it with Galvin. Funny, genuinely good guy who wants to help all of his students
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Professor Galvin is one of my favorite professor at ND. The material and quizzes wan't hard at all. Exams are based on homework and the grading is lenient. He was always willing to make his students to higher levels by giving challenging questions during the class. You will get an A if you want and put time in it.
Profesor Galvin is an amazing teacher but the class he teaches is insanely hard. I would recommend him as a professor but I would not recommend his class.
Probably the hardest class I have ever taken, but Galvin was great and hilarious, which kept me interested in the topics. Like I said, though, SUPER tough class.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Honors calc is the hardest class I have ever taken but Galvin's lectures are really good and entertaining and that got me through the class. Office hours and math bunker are definitely the best things for honors calc, though.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Hilarious

comment: Galvin will make you love doing the hardest stuff you have ever encountered in your young life.
DGalv  best professor
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Enthusiastic in teaching but the stuff he taught was a bit too easy.

Very tough grader. Native English speaker so her Spanish is easy to understand, but that didn't help me learn much. This class was super boring and I found it hard to engage with the material. This class made realize the Spanish major at Notre Dame isn't about learning the language and culture, but more analyzing literature in another language.

Katie is a great professor. I sometimes was just bored by the course content. Her Intro to Hispanic Lit. course is taught different than Prof. Schaefer's (she puts more focus on identidades y la mujer). Sometimes texts were dense and difficult, but don't be afraid to ask for help. Good professor and kind, but sometimes the class was just boring.

Katie is one kindest instructors on this campus. She wants you to succeed and gives great feedback. Her knowledge of Spanish is fantastic, and I learned so much in her course. If you have the chance to take a course with her, you should. As an advisor for the major, Katie is also available to give guidance on course offerings. Great professor!

Absolutely goated. Love this woman, her class is low stress and very manageable. Lenient with deadlines when I was struggling and was super understanding and fair. Participate in class and do your best on the papers and you'll be just fine. The TA was also super helpful if the readings every got confusing.

Such a caring professor. Oswald facilitates such a welcoming environment for everyone to participate during our discussions about the readings. There were three major essays and one final essay, which required a bit of work. The readings are dense at times, but our class discussions truly helped me comprehend Spanish literature. Highly recommend.

Take her class if you must take Spanish. She's funny, understanding, and helpful. She communicates well with students and gives easy homework, quizzes, and tests. The course is organized clearly and she grades fairly. Class is engaging with a variety of activities. She speaks almost exclusively in Spanish, but it's not as bad as you may fear.

I'd take a bullet for this woman. I had her for intermediate 1 & 2 and she's the best there is. She truly cares about her students and will help you in any way she can. there's a lot of work in the course but it's manageable. I love her & she's perfect.

Best. teacher. ever. I have never been so emotionally trusting of a prof, and Katie genuinely cares for her students in a way little other teachers do. She is patient, lenient with work, and cares about our well-being over everything. I love class every time and she makes me confident in my Spanish and abilities in other classes! She has my heart.

One of my favorite professors at Notre Dame, she really cares about her students and is very sweet. Gives incredible feedback and helps you learn. Very lenient with grading and kind of reminds me of my mom. Would 100% recommend!

Both Professor Meissner and the class were great. He selects some inspiring texts and leads in-depth discussions. Hes very personable and understanding towards student needs. That said, be prepared to read and write a lot for this class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Meissner is a very caring professor who definitely empathizes with his students. The class itself can be somewhat repetitive and dull with a fair bit of rambling on Meissners part. However, the literature he selects is interesting and he is skilled at pulling texts apart.

Most impactful class Ive taken at Notre Dame. He cares about what every student thinks. He understands and remembers what it was like to be a college kid. He has a way of drawing meaning out of pages meaning that will leave you with a hole in your chest or some hope on a crappy day.

Professor Meissner's seminar was one of my favorite classes of freshman year. He really cares about the students and facilitated us bonding as a group while facilitating our intellectual growth. He is really great at analyzing literature and bringing out discussion points which make you think in completely different ways. 10/10

Great prof. Class is casual and usually solely discussion. Really makes an effort to get to know students and make everyone comfortable in the class. Take him, it'll be fun if you're open to learning something.

Probably the best professor I've ever had--an amazing man with an amazing story who really is just looking to talk about books in a meaningful way. Class is always a casual, enjoyable and lively time while still maintaining structure. This guy is the real deal; you will never regret taking his class.

Does not have any structure. Rambles about whatever he wants. Repeats the same phrases about every book over and over. Doesn't give helpful feedback. Only his opinion is the right opinion. Gives random assignments and does not follow any type of syllabus for grading.
The best prof in AMST, hands down. Cares about teaching, discussion, ideas, and relates them to life without the superfluous jargon and ****. Well worth it.

30104- Most worthless professor ever.  No adherence to the syllabus, random papers whenever he felt like it, rambles in class about whatever he feels like.  No coherent direction.  Great if you don't care about learning or going to class, terrible if you like structure or getting your money's worth.

Professor Bodnaruk has a passion for finance, which is evident in his approach to teaching. I truly loved his class. He teaches financial principles in a manner that the student can easily apply the knowledge gained in the classroom to their life outside of it.

Professor presents a more human-oriented spin on the finance world. His assignments basically reinforce your comprehension of the lecture, but also ensures you're able to identify and summarize real world examples from theories in his lecture. Its overall enjoyable and I would recommend him as a professor.
Really interesting subject and great examples

He's one of the best Uic Finance professors that i took. The lectures were interesting and he makes it exciting to learn. He is fair when it comes to exams and grading. Come to class, take notes , listen and you will get an a.

One of the best professors in the UIC Finance Department. You will learn interesting concepts that you never even thought existed while evaluating markets and peoples behaviors. In my opinion it's a must take class in your into finance.

Funny, sarcastic professor who does an excellent job tying financial concepts to real life. Occasional interactive experiments in class. Laid back lecturing style; more concerned with the students actually gaining something than training them to memorize definitions/formulas.

Very passionate about the subject manner, very good at using empirical data to make his point.  Often interspersed his lecture with humorous stories and transitions.  I enjoyed the class and thought it was incredibly useful and profound.
Very funny and made class interesting. Great guy.
He is one of the best professors I have had, a genuinely good guy and really knows his stuff. Cares greatly about his students.

I am currently taking Dan's Composition 101 class at Holy Cross. He is very friendly and you can tell he really enjoys literature and his job. His icebreakers are my favorite and I think of a clever answer days prior to class. Dan often talks about superman and I suspect he knows that he looks exactly like a young Christopher Reeve. He's wonderful.

I loved his media and lit class. Dan is so funny and enthusiastic. I thought the course would be more about journalism, news, and media bias instead of a seminar on lit, movies, and pop culture, but it was really fun! I will never look at movies the same way. Also, he might actually be Indiana Jones.

Dan's class was my favorite course at ND my first year. I always struggled in english classes and I don't particularly like writing essays, but the class was fun and it helped me a lot with college writing . Dan is funny and chill, and we covered a lot of cool contemporary things in pop-culture from an academic viewpoint.

Dan is a great teacher. Very enthusiastic about the material and super encouraging. He is funny and SO goodlooking too. I am a much better reader and critical thinker after his course. Never will watch movies the same way again!

I am really enjoying the class. It has honestly been a lot of fun! The ice-breakers in particular are so funny and over-the-top. Dan is hilarious and has a laid back teaching style, which is conducive to good class discussions because he mixes serious high level discussion with humor and weird references. He is also quite handsome. Like really.

Dans is really funny. In all, the course as a whole was laid back and fun. The icebreakers are great. The class is almost like a English/philosophy class, though, in case that’s not your thing. As someone else mentioned, he is not an easy grader at all.  And girls, he’s really cute ;) I would take the class again in a heartbeat.

Dan is a good teacher and I ended up liking his class a lot; he is young, relateable and funny. The atmosphere in class was always relaxed even though the material is heavy. A word of warning, Dan is a tough grader. I never got higher than a B on any of my essays, even though I tried hard and went to the Writing Center a lot for help.
Been a great class so far. Fun discussions and we watch lots of good new movies. Dan is sometimes a bit too abstract, but he is very approachable and open if you meet with him outside of class.
Down to earth and funny Professor. He is really excited about english and movies and has a laid back and enthusiastic demeanor. Very encouraging and patient. And srsly, hot.
Great at building the foundations for new programmers.

One of the best professors I've had in my entire life. Makes content easy and accessible to students. Don't be afraid of the spring fun comp offering (even though Ramzi and a few advisors may say its harder, it's still super manageable)
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Universally beloved by students. He makes the subject interesting and going to class fun. Great at communicating the material, and doesn't waste your time. Class is project-heavy, but the projects are fun if difficult. You learn a lot. The only issue was misgrading by undergrad TAs, which to be fair he owned up to and fixed. Take him if you can!

Ramzi is spectacular amazing wonderful incredible. If you have a chance to take a class with him please do so for the love of God Country Notre Dame. His lectures are really good -- he does a great job making things clear and also is funny LOL. He's very flexible with due dates and often will ask the class when they would prefer the exam to be.
Ramzi is a great professor and better dancer
Ramzi, is the most amazing human ever. So kind, so genuine, a great professor, and cares so much about each student. I will miss seeing him every week !

Ramzi is the best professor I have ever had and remains my favorite! His lectures are always very engaging and well-done. I always looked forward to going to class and learned so much during this course. He shows so much respect towards his students, and you can tell he truly cares about our wellbeing. Highly recommend taking anything he teaches!!!
best professor I have ever had and probably will ever have. the most caring teacher and he really supports his students. his lectures are very clear and you will learn a lot from him!

The best professor you will ever have. Makes difficult content fun and exciting. Actually cares about his students and makes an effort to get to know all of them. Such an awesome person inside and outside of the classroom.
Ramzi is the best prof in the CS department... Truly the greatest teacher and person in general! Highly recommend any course he teaches

Nasir doesn't know the material at all, class was essentially taught by the TA. He has mistakes all over assignments and quizzes, and will not give you points back where deserved unless you email him 10+ times. Absolutely horrible.

Nasir is the best, he really cares about his students. If he likes you, he will make sure that you will succeed in the class. Would recommend talking to him/forming a relationship. Btech is pretty useful, it had been one of my favorite seq. 2 classes I have taken. As long as you do well on either the midterm or final you should be fine.

Let me begin by saying that Professor Ghiassedin is geuinely one of the nicest professors on campus. He really cares about his students and wants them to succeed. That being said, a lot of your grade is dependent on the midterm and final, which are both ridiculously difficult (the final in particular). Basically everything else you'll get a 100%.

Nasir is a great guy. He genuinely cares for his students and wants them to succeed. Although he sometimes struggles with the computer, the TAs are extremely helpful. The final is absolutely brutal but the curve helps.

Nasir was a very nice guy but the course was just OK. Unlike Lewandowski, you have to go into class to complete virtual assignments. Since most of the virtual assignments were on Fridays, this was a let down. 

The final exam is extremely difficult and the class average was 49/80. 

His videos were good, though, and his TAs were helpful.

Literally the nicest guy. You can tell he really cares about his students. He asked me personally every day how I was doing, which none of my other professors do. I definitely recommend going to office hours for assignments because they can be confusing.

Be prepared to learn a bit on your own outside of class. You can tell he cares about his students and wants them to succeed. Takes time to come around and ask how everyone's weekend was, day is going, etc.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Never fails to brighten up class. Grading on assignments can be tedious, so checking with TAs before turning them in is helpful.

I would highly suggest you try and take Lewandowski for intro to business analytics and technology. Nasir's language barrier makes the class pretty difficult and he really is not a master at the material. Coming to class was pretty much pointless. Definitely utilize office hours with the TA's for the assignments. Be ready to fail the final.

This class is not hard if you stay ahead of the work and study for the tests. She gives out graded homework for every chapter and as long as you try to understand the content and put effort forward, and A is not hard to achieve. Most of your grade consists of tests, but you will do well if you study and take the practice test.

Claire is very nice, engaging, and makes a sincere effort to break down the material and explain it.  She is also very responsive to questions and feedback.  However, the class itself is very difficult, with two intense exams + final.  You need to be on top of things from day one or you will fall behind.

Although the lectures can be boring at times due to it be accounting 1, Claire is super clear in teaching the content and the homework is minimal. The tests can be hard but are fair and doable if you study for them. The one issue I had was that she is very unavailable outside of class and the TAs are terrible.
Engaging and cares about her students. Pay attention, go to lectures and do recommended homework's and you will do well.

I love Claire as a person but as a teacher, she is only okay. She essentially just reads off the slides all class. I would say she relatively prepares us for tests, though they are very difficult. Also the group projects suck

I love Prof Donovan, but accounting is difficult, hence the difficulty level. However, she tries her best to be fair and goes through lectures slowly. You can tell she really cares for her students and is always accessible via email or in her office. Her exams are rough, but you have two group projects, made to save your grade.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: If you read the textbook and pay attention in class as well as understand all of the coursework, you will succeed. She is enthusiastic about the subject and understanding of students who have no familiarity with accounting

Professor Donovan really wants to be accessible to her students and uses the midterm survey to make changes. However the exams are incredibly difficult and the practice problems and homework did not help on the exam proportionally to the amount of time they took to do them. The lectures are pretty boring and there is a hefty amount of reading.

Never taken accounting before. She is very good at connecting back to the basics, super helpful. Don't put too much stock in the other reviews, the material is not difficult, homework is not required.

Claire is great! She was really good at contextualizing information as she used to work in PA and was really helpful in understanding the intuition behind some weird accounting principles. Claire's practice problems and homework assignments were conducive to learning the material, but in class, she taught almost directly off the slides.

An amazing professor who genuinely cares about students. She was very straightforward. The exams were challenging but there were no surprises and they were fair. Homework is optional but it really helps you to prepare for the exam.

Donovan teaches slowly and clearly, which I appreciated having no accounting experience. She is great in office hours and answers emails quickly. The exams are challenging but not impossible. There are 2 group projects, randomized groups. The hard part is the material, which isn't Donovan's fault. HW is optional but useful in practicing concepts.

She is a great professor and is very accessible outside of class if you need any help. Homework is optional, but it is extremely helpful for studying for her tests. The entire grade is essentially based on 3 tests, but the class is curved.

Good lectures, and she made Accounting 1 as entertaining as possible. My only two issues are that one chapter was taught completely over online videos and that her test roadmaps were rather cryptic compared to other classes that offer them.

Professor Donovan was a great professor. Her style of speaking was easy to follow because she spoke as if she was explaining something to young children (which makes sense because she has some of her own). The only difficult part of the class was the content itself. Do a good job of asking for help where needed and you'll succeed in the class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: I took him for POLS 20400 aka world politics intro to comparative. he's a nice guy. attendance wasn't mandated but I recommend you attend his lectures or you might get behind. not too difficult of a class as long as you pay attention and do the readings
He's a nice professor. Lots of reading but to be expected. he didn't take mandatory attendance but its not a good idea to skip. he did record lectures though. overall a nice person.

Very knowledgable and caring professor. Dr. Gould's class was a fun intro course that consisted of a good amount of reading and papers (which at times could be boring) but his lectures made it worthwhile. His grading guidelines were very clear and concise, so if you follow what the prompt says, you should be fine. Take his class!

Conflicted because Gould is really good and a nice person. His lectures can be a bit dry, but he cares about his students. His ta’s on the other hand are horrendous. Bryce is one of the worst people Ive encountered in my time at notre dame, and they do the grading/office hours. I would not recommend this class but only because terrible ta’s

Professor Gould is amazing! He's a little bit dry and can sometimes get lost in his lectures, but he's extremely knowledgable and a great lecturer. If you're not really interested in what he's teaching, it may be hard to pay attention sometimes, but if you like the topic, you'll love the class. He's a super nice guy and always willing to help.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: Everyone at Notre Dame is required to take a seminar, and I took Prof. Gould's on Religion and Democracy. You have to write 6 papers and do two presentations, but only two of the papers are above 2 pages in required length, and the presentations are 5 and 10-15 minutes long. On each essay he gives clear, fair, and helpful feedback. Great professor!

Professor Gould is incredibly knowledgable in his field. His TAs do a lot of the grading, but he's available to talk about the course, your life, or whatever you choose. He's subtly funny, so listen up or you may not get the joke!
No Comments
Extremely intelligent and helpful. A tremendous writer and a decent person.

Interesting lectures but LOTS OF READING!!! Additionally, be prepared to have the smallest pieces of information from the readings show up on the tests in the multiple choice. What he calls "quizzes" are really pretty intense tests, do not take them lightly you have to study. Participation matters a lot and is a decent percentage of the grade.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Lectures were always awesome. Lots of reading for homework.

Any classes Magister Mazurek teaches are fantastic. For Latin II, translation and vocabulary lists are very manageable. Tests and vocab quizzes are fair and do not require a lot of preparation. There are online exercises for extra practice and he is frequently available outside of class for any questions. Overall, a great experience.
Prof Mazurek is amazing. 10/10 recommend any of his classes.

I would miss Professor Mazurek after I finish this semester! You can tell he loves his job, gave us extra credits when he wanted us to come to a event about the classics just so we can have fun. Very accessible outside class, I like sharing Latin songs I am singing with him after class, we would work through the translation and that is always fun.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Best teacher, 10/10
Great guy, difficult class, be ok if you get a lower grade
Wonderful professor, he keeps content interesting. There is a lot of reading, but that shouldn't be a surprise for a classics course.
He is very interested in what he teaches, entusiastic, ect.
Probably the best professor I have ever had
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: If you are lucky enough to make it into this course, go stop by the Grotto and offer a prayer in gratitude. Fr. Sullivan will be one of the best professors you take at ND. He is incredibly kind, caring, and humble. Oh AND HE'S ALSO A GENIUS (which can be a bit intimidating). His class is the epitome of Glynn Honors glory. Take him.

I LOVE Father Sullivan's class. He's such a cool guy in general, and I always feel inspired to learn more about the world simply because he seems to know so much. He's also genuinely very caring and thinks about our wellbeing. There is a lot of reading for the class, but you get used to it. Regular short papers, but overall not too much work.
Very nice and gives great feedback.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: Father Sullivan is amazing. I love his class, I was upset when I got sick once and couldn't make it. There is a lot of reading and short weekly papers, but the discussions are so engaging and rich that it is always a joy to participate. I recommend his seminar to every Glynn student, because he is kind, understanding, and very intelligent.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: As a Glynn student, I highly recommend Professor Sullivan. Homework is typically 20-50 pages of reading, however, only a basic understanding is needed. Classes are discussions led by students. This class is paper heavy, but Sullivan is not a harsh grader and is available outside of class to discuss any ideas.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Father Sullivan is not only incredibly intelligent, but also very caring and understanding. Readings can be a bit heavy and tough to grasp and you'll have to write a lot of short papers, but the work is very manageable and he is flexible with deadlines. You will get smarter and develop some essential thinking skills from class discussions alone.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--So many papers--Caring

comment: Attention Glynn students! If you have the chance to take a class with Father Sullivan, do so! In my opinion, he is the best professor at Notre Dame. He genuinely cares about all of his students and is very accommodating as long as you work hard. He makes his classes enjoyable to attend, and you will learn a ton! Take his course! You wont regret it!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Father Sullivan is the best professor I've had! He is an amazing guy that will do anything for his students. Be prepared to read in this class and write many papers. The class discussions and readings are very interesting, and the workload for the class is manageable, but a bit challenging at times. Take him if you can, you won't regret it!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Inspirational

comment: Overall great professor. She is very passionate about the course and is able to make sometimes boring material pretty interesting by tying it to real world scenarios and is also a fair grader. If you do the all of recommended homework before exams and review the material well the exams are not that bad. I would highly recommend taking her course.

A great professor, very passionate and engaging. Lectures are all slides and grade is based on participation, 3 exams (watch out for the second!), 2 group projects, and weekly homework. Exams can be difficult, so preparation is necessary. Very accessible outside class. Highly recommend!
Excellent. Very generous with partial credit on exams and group projects. Do the recommended homework and practice tests and there should not be any surprises on the exams.

An amazing person with a lot of industry experience who was very accessible outside of class. My only critique was that taking notes during class was kinda hard sometimes, so you will have to spend time with slideshows outside of class.

Had industry experience and tried to make the classes interactive/engaging, fell short in helping you prepare for the exam though. Group project was also graded strangely, wasn't conducive to how much effort you put in the class.
Lots of slideshows which was kind of boring, but she was very helpful in explaining if you had any questions and she was very accessible outside of class.
She's a very god professor overall but the course is somewhat difficult
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Does her best to get everyone in class engaged by asking lots of questions. If you are engaged in each class you can get a good grade without studying a ton. You won't find anything too surprising on the exams.

Ilona has a lot of passion for accounting. She is not the best at explaining accounting topics. She is good at being open to office hours and puts in the effort to make her class the best. This year was her first year teaching, so she has a lot of room to improve in the coming years.

Very nice professor. Truly cares about the well-being of her students and tries her best to be accessible outside of the classroom. She talks pretty fast during lectures but can be humorous most times. You'll deal with case study group projects, three exams (increases in difficulty), and homework that isn't graded but extremely helpful for exams!
rating_tags: Group projects--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Initially hard, gets better, good person, ok teacher

She is amazing. 
100% recommend taking foundations with her. She is super nice and energetic, which makes all lectures fun. Her smile is always present and she will go through anything you don't understand multiple times. She truly wants the best for her students and she is very accessible. HW is optional but DO THEM, the exams come from those.

He isn't the best lecturer but definitely puts in the work to make the semester easier for students. He obviously cares about students and his job. Not super easy but pretty fair tests and homework and the workload is not too heavy.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: He was the best math professor I had. He always kept the class engaged, and he explained concepts extremely well. Prof. Huynh tries very hard, and he does all he can to help his students succeed. The tests are easy because he teaches well. Highly recommend
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Great guy. Explains the concepts really well so even if you have never seen any of that stuff, you will still understand. He has notes that you just fill out during class, so it is highly beneficial to attend.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Huy is very straightforward. He let's you bring in a 6 by 4 notecard into the tests, so there's that. The one potential downside is his sometimes thick accent, but he puts in a lot more effort into teaching the class than most Native English speaking professors.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: This class is cake, and Huy Huynh is awesome. He loves his students and his students love him too. Take this class. He passes out sheets for notes for students to follow along and fill out, and for my class, he used a camera in the room to record every class and post the lectures online. This class is cake, and Huy Huynh is the best.
Great teacher, and although he does have an accent he is extremely thorough and descriptive in his lectures and I have never had a problem understanding what he is saying. Would HIGHLY recommend
Great prof, highly recommend

He is incredibly easy to understand and accurate. Many of the math teachers I've had in the past made frequent mistakes while teaching, which only makes the material harder to learn, however this Professor rarely made errors.
He has a strong accent but is very descriipive, and is a great teacher..

He taught one of my favorite classes at ND and helped me really understand the Catholic faith in a way that I never did before. The class was a good amount of work, but but putting in the work you get a LOT out of it. His lectures are fun and interesting. Probably the best professor at ND.
Really interesting lectures, not too difficult, I easily got an A.

This isn't a critique of Cavadini, he's great. But if you're planning to take The Catholic Faith, I would not recommend. Assignments are frequent and tedious and graded harshly by TA's, exams are filled with poorly worded multiple choice about technicalities in the Catechism. Even though I like Cavadini, avoid this Theo.

The other reviews are accurate. JC is a great guy. If you are interested in Theology, this class is probably good for you. However, the lecture notes are tedious and graded harshly, and this class can become a lot of effort when there are better alternatives. Not the worst class, but there's def better. DONT BUY THE CCC book. Its online for free.

The majority of what the average student will take theology classes for is to fulfill the university requirement.  These classes are not the blow-off classes.  If you go into this expecting your high-school religion classes to carry you through the course, you are mistaken.  For those actually interested in theology, this is who you want.

never again. 400 WORD SUMMARY FOR EVERY CLASS. lectures were long&boring, John's a cutie tho. if the summaries were graded easily I'd be fine w this class but holy smokes. I've gone to catholic school for 14 yrs & I know how to take a theo course. this course made me rethink everything. I would put in max effort for the summaries and get an 80/90
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: I'll reiterate what others said, but be more assertive: BORING lectures; Take good notes or else you cant write 400 word lecture summaries; TAs are HARSH graders; HUGE class, NO discussion, but still checks attendance; Notes not posted, but you can rewatch the lecture if you're having trouble sleeping at night. Nice guy, but big PASS from me.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Whether you should take this class depends on whether you'd rather write full-length essays or page-long summaries every class. He has you write summaries of every lecture, so if that's you'd rather do that, take this class. Tests are fair. He's quirky, nice, and occasionally funny, but lectures sometimes left me drowsy

While it is clear that Cavadini puts a good deal of effort into appearing friendly and humorous to students, I would not recommend The Catholic Faith course to others because of the heavy workload and boring lectures. A summary and explanation of each class's lecture is due every week in addition to readings. The lectures were also very dry.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Duffy is a caring professor. He tried to make the 1619 USEM course as good as possible, yet I often felt like I could not share my true opinions as discussions were often dominated by the same people. Also very hard to know your grade until the very end. If you lose participation points at the beginning for being shy, there is no coming back.

I had Professor Duffy for the CSEM Great Speeches. He is a very caring and interesting professor and is always willing to help his students. The class is based on three speeches that you will memorize and present. I really recommend Professor Duffy for this class or any other! Super fun and useful CSEM to take.

Prof. Duffy makes sure that every opinion is heard. He always wants us to be intellectually honest and generous. The class itself is discussion heavy - so make sure you do the readings. The class is what you make of it, so make the most of it! Prof. Duffy is the best at what he does and truly wanted his students to succeed.

Professor Duffy is one of, if not the, best professor that I have had. He does a fantastic job at facilitating conversation between students and himself in the class. He is a tough grader on essays; however, he is willing to meet with you to review the comments and gives you the chance to resubmit every essay. I highly recommend his class!
Probably one of the best professors I had at Notre Dame. Very compassionate and very kind. Truly has a passion for what he is teaching. He is a must take at ND
Bad attitude. Dont recommend taking his class.
Amazing!! Very nice guy. He is passionate about what he teaches.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: His class was eye-opening. I had a relatively simplistic understanding of certain issues because I hadn't spent much time thinking through them. This class complicated my view and helped me see things in a different way. Very good discussions and Prof. Duffy is just a really nice guy

He taught "Writing for Social Justice," a freshman university seminar. Prof Duffy is so incredibly understanding and helped us see all the sides of someone's story before we could judge. Knowledgable on the subject of social justice and passionate about understanding prominent social issues, he showed real interest in what we had to say.

Presented the readings in such an awesome way and really made the class enjoyable. There like 7 graded writing assignments which arent too long and are chill. Readings are interesting but for some of the long ones finding an audiobook on youtube with 2x speed is helpful
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Caring

comment: His course on Greco-Roman classics is a fantastic option for USEM. Probably one of the smartest people on campus. It is clear he is an absolute genius when it comes to ancient Greece and Rome. Very engaging class with great lecture/discussion hybrid. Reading is very manageable. Assignments aren't too bad and he gives great feedback.

Professor Krostenko is great! Super passionate about the material and his slideshows are so sick. They really aid in your comprehension of the material and are interesting and engaging. Decent amount of reading for each class, but short essays and quizzes/exams aren't graded too hard. Encourages conversation during parts of class. Would take again!

Professor Krostenko really knows what he's talking about. In-class discussions are great because he never shoots down anybody's ideas and always finds a way to incorporate it into the subject at hand. Really enjoyable professor and would highly recommend him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Respected

comment: I took Prof. Krostenko's USEM on epics. The class was overall very engaging and enjoyable. Though this professor is sometimes harder to reach outside of class, he is altogether very approachable and gives detailed and helpful feedback on papers.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: I took Brian Krostenko's class "Words in Time" during my senior year.  One of the most memorable, interesting, and enjoyable classes of college.  Perhaps the best class I ever took.  Worth the price of tuition.
the best profesor I have ever seen

Dr. Krostenko is the best prof I had at ND.  His classes were amazing.  He was almost good enough to keep me at Notre Dame after my masters.  How he manages to stay around the bleak scene at ND is beyond me.

Prof. Krostenko is the most approachable, competent, lucid, and interesting classics professor in the entire world.  He's also a skilled linguist.  If you don't take Professor Krostenko, or if you do and don't work hard enough to pass, shame on you.
Outstanding teacher in the classroom . . . unbelievable.  But don't try to contact him during office hours, very inaccessible and unaccommodating.
Perfect Moreau for those who don't care. Basically an automatic A if you submit the assignments and hit the word minimum.
Nice guy. Strangely, I dont think he is a very good percussionist, but he seems to enjoy his job and is likeable
His moreau section was very easy. You basically can get full credit just for submitting the assignments.
Definitely take him for Moreau. I copy and pasted Taylor Swift lyrics every time for the weekly prompts and got 100% in the class.
Sam is my favorite person in the entire world, cares about as much as we do about Moreau, and he has the cutest dog named Edwin.
Great director, and a superb conductor. Manages the concert band extremely well in rehearsals and concerts, and is also excellent with the marching band
The guy who graduated but could never leave.  Still thinks he's an undergrad and tries to be one even tho he's not.
I love his sunglasses.
Sam's awesome.

Hard but fulfilling class. I really enjoyed the teaching style and the content. He is no longer teaching the class I took but for anyone taking his other classes I'd recommend going to all the lectures, going to office hours/staying after class to ask questions.

Professor ashfeld is the most enthused faculty that I have met in organic chemistry. His intentions are fantastic, yet not received well.
 . 
He needs to put more emphasis on the topic of transition states and why they are important for understanding. Papers are great but more beneficially, helping students through ex. TS.s would be more efficient.

Prof. Ashfeld cares about his students so much. It's so easy to get help outside of class as he offers review sessions and office hours. Orgo is the most difficult course I've taken at this school, but he makes it bearable! Attendance is not mandatory but if you skip a lecture you're screwed. Would totally take him again!
He cares. He gives you every tool you need, its just up to you to use them. Would recommend and would take again if I could. Best possible teacher for Orgo 2 here.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: Ashfeld cares so much about his students and goes above and beyond for them. He knew everyone's name in our class of 70 and made Orgo 2 fascinating and entertaining. Orgo 2 has a nasty reputation but I always looked forward to his lectures. Hands down the hardest class I've taken but would take again no doubt. I cried a little when it was over.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Best professor I've had at Notre Dame so far. Even though the material was difficult, I looked forward to going to his class. Very fair professor with a great sense of humor and extremely good at explaining tough concepts.

The best professor I have ever had hands down. He is so dedicated and wants his students to succeed. He makes orgo so fun i started to question whether i really like chemistry or i simply enjoy his lectures.
Orgo 2 sucks, but Ashfeld makes it amazing. It may have still been tough, but his comedy made it worth it.

The best professor I've ever had. He took a dreaded subject and made it inspiring, fun, and fulfilling. Lectures are engaging, homework is relevant and helpful, tests are straightforward and reasonable in their difficulty.
Honestly the best Prof I've ever had. Enthusiastic, great office hours, clear, and very funny.
just great!
Professor Heidle is the best!
Hans was the absolute best. We'll miss you!

I missed a quiz in this guys class b/c I had to go back to NY for my grandmother's funeral and so he screwed me over in the class by not letting me makeup the quiz which ended up being 30% of the final exam.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments

By far the most bad tempered and disagreeable professor I've ever had. Singlehandedly responsible for my decision to change majors-legit made me cry during office hours. Grading is arbitrary and she will take off points if you don't follow her method, even if your answer is correct. Overly self-important and has an
extremely condescending manner.

The course material was easy enough, but the professor made it unnecessarily complicated. I got the impression that she is uncomfortable teaching this material. There were several students like me who already had a background in music, who didn't get anything out of this course, since the professor was unable to teach advanced concepts.

Her class is highly structured and structured well. However, It is so extreme that she belittles you if you aren't following the exact pattern and process she prescribes. She is extremely condescending when addressing questions, but she is sometimes helpful during office hours. Really wish I didn't have to take 3 classes with her.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Her expectations for her students are beyond what I've ever been asked. The nature of this class was to develop writing skills, yet she required well-revised formal writing for every class (500 words). She gives unclear feedback, although throughout, and grades way too hard. And just likes to listen to herself talk, and her own writing has errors.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Frymoyer is very good at teaching writing. She was much more critical of my writing than teachers in years past, which helped me a lot with developing my ideas. I will say that at some times, she was a little too critical, but this was not a super common occurrence. The class itself (Music, Gender, and Sexuality) was incredibly interesting.
I felt confused a lot of the time during Dr. Frymoyer's classes. I generally struggle with music theory, but taking her course did not help me improve my knowledge of the subject.

This seems to be Dr. Frymoyer's first semester here at ND. She clearly needs more time here, since her instruction was awful. Her lectures were meandering and confusing, and she had no clear grading criteria whatsoever. Not recommended.
Very helpful and kind; feedback is always very detailed. A little bit tough at grading, though, so an A is not easy

Struggled with Calc 3, partially due to this prof. Disorganized and hard to follow, felt like he'd jump into examples before explaining what was happening. I would constantly be searching through the pages for where we were or what we were doing. Still, the Calc 3 ND curriculum is across all sections and forgiving (A- without attending lectures)

Professor Cholak generally is great. He makes jokes and brings a fantastic attitude to class. However, he tends to act a little scatterbrained, and he gets off topic very easily, meaning we often did not finish the lecture material during class time.

Professor Cholak is a great man, but gets a little lost sometimes when he is in lecture. Especially when running out of time, he tends to rush and do a poor job explaining difficult concepts. He makes up for it with his smiley attitude, always willing to crack a joke.

I was in Professor Cholak's 8am lecture and he honestly made it interesting to come to class. He always cracks jokes and tries to make the class engaging. I feel like he could have done a bit better in going over more examples in class as he likes to show students proofs of what we're learning instead of how to apply it. But he was overall great!

Cholak was a hoot. Easier than AP Calc, but you'll have to put in a little extra work if you haven't taken calc before. Attendance is not mandatory, but he enjoys seeing people come. Homework is consistent but manageable. Tests aren't bad, but each mc question is worth 4-6pts w/ no partial credit. On the frqs, he is generous on partial credit.

I enjoyed Prof. Cholak's course on Multivariable Calc. Homework was designed really well and was due Friday, with a quiz on the prior week's material Monday. Easy format to follow, and made comprehension easy instead of big exams. Goes out of his way to help students.

He's caring and funny and often cracks jokes in class. If you tell him "ive taken math for years and still can't divide by zero" he'll love you. His Elements of Calc class is literally AP calc. Homework is simple w/ 10 tries on every problem and the tests are exactly like the practice tests he gives you. Sometimes he's difficult to understand
Good guy who cares about students and won't kill you with homework. Quizzes and tests are easy and completely taken from in class problems. No surprises
He's an awesome guy and a great professor. I highly recommend taking his class!
the exam questions are all incredibly niche and things you probably wouldnt know even if you fully knew all the readings. feels like a random trivia class

The tests are kinda ridiculous. They are really bad formatted and questions are asked in really weird and nit picky ways. The class itself was good and would recommend it but the tests are the only annoying part.
unfair multiple choice quizzes requiring absurd memorization
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Nice professor. He tried to make the material (which was pretty bland) more entertaining. His quizzes required a decent amount of studying and just pulled random details from the slides. Not worth reading the textbook, just memorize the slides. The homework is really easy and requires basically no work.

Prof. Levey is so freaking amazing. Although BLAW is rarely anyones favorite hw to do, or favorite class to attend, his lectures are fun and attention-grabbing with video clips and interactive questions!
His exams are all MC, which is nice for someone who doesn't love writing. Do required readings & attend class to do well.

The class itself is only half a semester so everything counts. Professor Levey is a very easy-going guy. His lectures definitely got dull at times. The quizzes were always on things discussed in class; however, sometimes these things were only briefly mentioned. It basically felt like both he and I were there because we had to be.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: There was more workload for this one class than the equivalent of two other classes. Tons of readings and he constantly pushes class material (videos etc) to homework. Extremely long slide decks for each 75 minute class that averaged 100 slides each that can be content heavy. Quizzes/tests are difficult and classes are too fast paced.

I agree with the other review, especially for his B Law class. However, I am now in his ethics class and I think it's quite a bit easier than B Law. The comment about the Mendoza curve still applies (he would like to give more A's but cannot). Participation matters and there are group projects but the class isn't bad at all.

So because of the Mendoza curve, Professor Levey has to make it difficult, but it's so obvious that he wishes it wasn't like that. He cares about what he teaches and is the most engaging professor you will ever have. Hard class, but not because of him. Prepare to study and feel defeated, but he will help you laugh through the pain.

I love Professor Deneen. So intelligent, well-spoken, and respected. The readings were always interesting and relevant, the lectures expanded upon them and everything made sense. There were a few pop quizzes, but they aren't too bad. I  had to write one paper and there were two exams. Everything was manageable, and he's awesome.

Your grade is primarily made up of two exams (also a paper and 3 pop quizzes) and is entirely dependent on your TA (I was fortunate to have a nice one). Content is very challenging, so make sure to do the readings. Attending lectures is critical for success, but generally I was confused about what was expected for studying and writing the paper.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Two tests, one essay, and three quizzes are the ultimate grade. Content is challenging and hard to read, hence why you should go to TA's once every two weeks if possible. Lectures are important to understand the content, but slides are just a quote on a screen. Feels like a level 3 course. But very engageful, interesting, necessary, and enjoyable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Prof Deneen is so dry and the lectures were boring. The readings are long and boring. I had a really tough TA who graded harshly. 0/10 wouldn't recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: 40-50 pages of reading per week, no turn in homework or papers so hard to gauge your understanding of material. overall pretty difficult; not a throw away class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Deneen was an amazing lecturer and was very insightful about the material covered in class. He did a great job of promoting my interest in the subject matter and the topic for our class (Utopian and Dystopian Literature) was a lot of fun. This class is reading and paper heavy, but it pays off in the end.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: This was an amazing class. My classmates were great, but Deneen was definitely what made this course special. His lectures and insight were astounding and he really got me into the material, even though this wasn't a class I was taking by choice. I would recommend Prof. Deneen to anyone. I will say, there was a lot of reading and papers.
Deneen is a very knowledgable guy. Political theory with him is really an adventure. Lots of reading though, and a few papers.
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment:
Meyer is one of the best profs in Mendoza. Your grade is almost entirely dependent on 3 exams for CFR, which he makes purposely difficult to separate the good students from the best. No busy work or projects.

The class is super interesting and Meyer is extremely funny. For all finance majors, if Meyer is teaching CFR, take it with him.

His Accounting 2 class is my favorite class to attend this semester! The tests are hard but fair. He makes the lectures so interesting and applicable to our lives, and he does a great job keeping us engaged in class.

Don't know about Accounting I but I wouldn't recommend for Accounting II. Goes through lecture notes very fast. Isn't a very organized course. Exams are overly difficult. Attendance is mandatory and I don't feel like I gain much from it. Overall, just hard to keep up.

Three exams. The material isn't hard but you're competing with your classmates on the curve. Meyer is enthusiastic and ALWAYS brings the energy to the class. The more you give to him, the more he'll give back. His lectures never last more than half the class, so he puts The Profit on to show real-life applications and tells stories about material.

Michael Meyer is by far the best teacher I have had in my time at Notre Dame. He is very energetic and passionate about both accounting and Notre Dame, and it makes his lectures easy to sit through. He is a huge fan of group work, and a truly excellent teacher

I've heard that Meyer is the best introductory accounting professor (but now that each prof makes their own test it doesn't matter as much). I like how he sets up class where he lectures for the first part and then gives a problem to work on as a group. He is also a very funny person and seems to care about his students.

Meyer is fantastic, and he teaches the material way better than the other professors.  He gives you a little 4 point quiz each week, but honestly they are not a big deal, and they help you to keep up with the material.  He is super full of energy and very loud, probably good to take him in the morning because he will wake you up.
All of the accounting professors give the same test and it is written by Meyer so if you want to be prepared for the exam make sure you get him

He's a great teacher and really cares most about his students. Was a tough grader on select projects, especially group projects. Made class as engaged as possible and tried to help out. Homework get increasingly longer to complete but you learn a lot.

I took Professor Smith's Engineering Design class, and I couldn't recommend him more. He's a careful explainer, has a fantastic sense of humor, and is willing to support students however they need it.

I really enjoyed Dr. Smith's Engineering Class. His lectures made sense and he was caring. Even though we were a class of 50, he took time to get to know us. Assignments were graded toughly (but he stuck to the rubric). Overall, Dr. Smith is a great teacher that I would recommend 10 times out of 10.
Always willing to provide clear and useful help.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Overall, professor Smith was an awesome professor and a great person. Not only did he teach well, but he made an effort to know everyone personally if he could. He is a harsh grader, and I do feel there was a lack of insightful feedback sometimes. Solid 8/10 experience, would recommend
Nice guy and solid teacher.  Difficult grader.
