Really horrid teaching style for a writing workshop. Didn't inspire discussion, just talked ad nauseum about himself.
No Comments
He's the greatest!

Great guy, the girl's swimming coach whose also a triathlete. If you take his class he knows how to keep it entertaining and always relates the subject back to you, making it easy to understand and fun to sit in.
Josh Skube is awesome
No Comments
Skube is the man.
Worst professor I ever had.
Hahn was an amazing professor. He is my personal favorite. You will not fail this class, but be prepared to try.
Are you kidding?  He was just about the best professor I've had.  And he really likes teaching students, which is more than I can say for a lot of professors.

To make an A or a B in the class is really not too tough.  The quizzes and test are not too tough.  The homework packets are near impossible and only losely realted to anything that happens in the class.  Hahn is very academic.
No Comments

The biweekly readings and three papers were a lot of work, but Prof. Duarte's numerous, detailed comments really helped me improve my writing and increase clarity. I enjoyed the readings and discussion topics he selected, especially the more modern works. He does care a lot, which was very inspirational. Kind of reminds me of Walter White.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: Straight forward man, will tell you things as they are, very evident when getting feedback. Writings more discussion based, explaining argument of text than actual content. Would highly recommend meeting with him before each assignment. It helps with clearly understanding the text. Discussions are far more interesting if you participate.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Professor Duarte is a tough professor. Readings were very dense, and he was rather cold during discussions. He is a very harsh grader and has no problem critiquing a paper word by word. If you are looking for an easy A class to fulfill the university Philo requirement, do not take Duarte, you have better luck with GGL.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: His in-class presence is fine, and discussions are sometimes informative/interesting. However, he is an incredibly tough grader who did not elaborate on grading when asked. After putting in countless hours for his papers, asking for his help, and still performing poorly, his class has neither improved my skills nor prepared me for more.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Great professor, engaging, experienced, will take more of his classes.

Love Prof. O'Malley, very knowledgable, entertaining, and hilarious lecturer.  Course requirements were kind of choose-your-own-adventure, where you could either do five 1,000 word papers, one mega research paper, or discussion groups.  He is very accessible outside of class, happy to help, and very flexible (sometimes pushes back deadlines).

Very engaging lecturer & interesting class. Cares about students and willing to help out. There was no homework and I did not do the readings. 5 writing assignments ranging from 1000-2000 words. Took some time to write them. Not the easiest grader, you have to put in effort to get an A on the assignments but not hard to get A- esp. with grade boost
kind of boring and the essay prompts were so open-ended lots of kids got poor grades (don't know if he grades below a 75% tho)

Nuptial Mystery with Tim was extremely easy. Your grade was determined by 5 papers, each worth 20%. There was no other homework. I never did the reading, went on my phone during the class, wrote gibberish on the essays, and I still easily got an A. Tim took like a month to grade the assignments, but he always pushed the due date back.
One of the most interesting and engaging classes, and it's not that difficult to receive a good grade.

O'Malley and Nuptial Mystery are great. Def one of the best second theos to take. You can go on a date for extra credit to boost your grade (like A- to A, B+ to A-). I took it fall 2020 so things were different because of covid but we had weekly zoom discussions (you choose group) and weekly 2-3 page reflections, and then an oral group final. EZ
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Prof. Kelsey is a very nice man but the lectures can get very boring if you don't enjoy/pay attention to the material. He is a philosopher's philosopher and would highly recommend to anyone who loves the subject. If you don't, this might be a long semester.
He obviously cared about the course material. He was extremely engaging and did a good job of answering questions. However, his lectures were sometimes pretty scattered and hard to follow.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Professor Kelsey is extremely intelligent and dedicated to helping his students understand difficult concepts. He gives great examples and simplifies complicated ideas. Lectures were sometimes hard to follow, but his notes were really helpful and he does a good job answering questions. Pay attention and go to office hours and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Kelsey is one of the best teachers ever, but sadly the material didn't interest me so i didn't spend much time working hard. Definitely possible to get an A, just go to his office hours. He is just such a smart and interesting guy, even though I wasn't always engaged in class, i loved going every time
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: My favorite Prof that I have had to date. I took his seminar and was not initially excited but his passion and knowledge about the subject matter make the class worth while and fun. He seems to know everything. He wants you to do well and he will help you do so - although its not the letter grade that is important to him. Great teacher, great guy!
Amazing Moreau Prof. Really makes you feel comfortable at ND
Very good teacher with style.

Professor Deak always talked about how he wanted his students to get A's but his grading said otherwise. I felt like the midterm and final were subjective and it just depended on whether a nice TA graded it or not. The class really isn't a lot of work, it's just subjective. I feel like you could take an easier class to get the WKHI requirement.

Took Deak's Nazi Germany, Nazi Europe class. Fantastic class, highly recommend Deak as he is both caring and hilarious - he makes the lectures fun. He also is tenured and would like to see all of his students get A's, so the class isn't too difficult if you are willing to do the work and read. Great class, even better professor.
Professor is funny and great. Highly recommend
Awesome class! Awesome person who cares!

The only thing I can say about the disaster that was an International Business Transaction, is that I got a better grade because I had the right font size and did not forget to double space. Emailing an entire class during finals week 2 days after we've taken an exam with pointless exam tips for different classes is not cool
Not very well organized. Exam questions are very confusing and, convoluted. Her communication style is not helpful to the subject matter.
Not very well organized. Her exam was very confusing.

Really good professor and especially good at facilitating discussions. I took his class on lit and ecology and was surprised how invested I became in the class as the semester went on. One of those classes I'm really glad I took. Not at all an 'easy A' but not overly difficult either if you do the work and show up to class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Great professor. Very accessible. You get what you deserve instead of just an A.

I took literature and ecology - I loved each of the reading choices, and while it is a discussion based class, he helps everyone get a chance to participate without putting anyone on the spot. He also seems to genuinely care about each student. Definitely recommend his class!
Such a great prof...very understanding, very interesting, and very interested in getting you to understand the material.  All hail Professor Sitter!
Always started class with a joke. Good guy all around. Tests were very fair.
Not a great teacher.
Had this guy as a lecturer over 20 years ago.  Thought he did a great job.  At least he doesn't speak with a heavy accent, which the other physics profs I had did.
Trying to make it so hard that no one wants to take it.  He has made me hate physics a subject i used to love.  Learn to teach the stuff you test on!
Really learned a lot and didn't think I'd enjoy it, but I did!
Really interesting class, well-organized, prof very friendly and helpful
Great Prof. Always available for office hours.  helpful
No Comments

Prof. Stober is a pretty decent professor. The lectures are boring and straight from the notes, but I believe all accounting classes are like that. He's very nice and willing to help students. Class is relatively easy if you do the homework and read the notes.

Stober is solid. Class is kinda dry and slow, but he often lets you out early if the material's done, which is nice. Tests are hardish (esp. the 2nd), but Mendoza curve helps in the end. Do the homeworks, show up to most classes, and study for the tests, and it should be easy enough to get a B+ or so. A- is a little harder, but not by much.

Extremely dry professor, reads his powerpoint lectures verbatim. Class average on the second test was 63%, so expect Mendoza curve to likely help you in the overall grade. Often tests on material that is briefly/not mentioned in lecture, so I prob look at the textbook before class. Class is relatively easy, but he does little to help
rating_tags: Group projects--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Stober is a really nice guy. His class can be a little dry, but what intro to accounting class isnt? Mendoza curve will save you in the end so dont be surprised if one or two of the exams dont go your way. Three exams, one final and a few group projects. He does take attendance so try to not miss class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Professor is only interested in advertising her invented 'methods' of psychology, which are nonsense. More interested in telling students why the rest of the world is wrong than teaching any material. Class material has little to no relationship on the textbook but both are tested heavily, 150+ textbook pages per exam. Avoid at all costs.
She is very nice and funny, but she is a truly awful professor. I learned nothing. I taught myself literally everything. Do not take her class.

Do not take this class. Nice person and I am sure I would like her if I weren't in her class, but she should not be a teacher. All she does, every day all class, is advertise her book and teach us absolutely nothing. Then we get tested on 5 chapters worth of information she never taught us, not bc she didn't have time but bc she chose not to.

You're going to have to rely almost entirely on the book for her class. She teaches you almost nothing other than deductive reasoning, which is basically her way of life. She's funny, but not really there to teach psychology.
Umesh Garg makes it happen. Plain and simple. Yeah the class isn't free but that why you're paying for it. Go to lecture, take notes, go to help sessions, and pray. Then keep doing that. I liked him.

Listen the bad reviews are understandable but Professor Garg gets too much hate.  He is pretty terrible at explaining the concepts, but his class time is hilarious. You just have to forget about Physics for an hour and appreciate the beautiful disaster that is a Garg lecture.  You can figure the material out later.
Not very good. Lectures are useless, and overall just a very hard class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: Extremely poor lecturer; does not care about the students or the course at all. Worst educational experience I've ever had.
Terrible lecturer and communicator, much too harsh of a grader and never in line with the other professors in the section. NO sympathy to students.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Physics for physics majors was a disaster -- you get behind and you're done for.

I enjoyed her lectures, they were very entertaining. She likes to use different media to explain concepts discussed in class. Sometimes she pulls up fun YouTube videos to discuss similar themes in our readings. Very easy to reach outside of class and very kind too! If you have the chance, take her class!

I loved Prof. Bolten's class! Attendance is mandatory, but she makes the lectures and content really interesting. The paper topics are unique and you get to choose which one to write about, and she's not a particularly difficult grader (though half are graded by her TA). You can get by without doing the readings, but I recommend at least skimming.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: I took Dr. Bolten's USem class and loved it. She gives you the freedom to write your papers on what you thought was interesting in the novels, which really helped to improve my writing style and express myself. She has a great sense of humor and loves class discussion. Definitely recommend.

I took Professor Bolten for my USem credit, and I was pleasantly surprised by how enjoyable the class was. The class is graded only on papers and participation, and she is a tough grader, but if you take the time to ask her questions and go in for help she'll do her best to help you get that A. #SierraLeone (You'll understand)
rating_tags: Tough Grader--SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: The lectures got a little boring at times but he is an extremely interesting guy with tons of stories he drops on the class from time to time. The homework can get challenging but the exams always had very fair and straightforward questions. He prepares you for DOME yet doesn't overcomplicate things in the process.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: I wrote a previous review for Prof Ovaert for his Solid Mechanics class. I really enjoyed him as a professor then and decided to take him for Heat Transfer. I thought it would be similar and I could coast a little through the class. It was very different, he was less pleasant, and the class was harder. Would take for Solids, but try to avoid for HT

Prof Ovaert is awesome. Very clear lecturer who makes pretty complex material much easier to understand. Compared to the other Solids professors, I'm really glad I got him. Said he prepares you well for DOME which is a big plus. Tests are super fair and hw isn't too bad. Financial Fridays are an awesome bonus where he teaches you real life finances

I didn't love this class while I was in it, but now I could not be more grateful for Dr. Ovaert. He covered the entire textbook, which was so helpful moving forward with higher-level classes. The homework was very difficult, but it made the exams seem easy. 100/10 would take another class with Dr. Ovaert. I cannot rate him highly enough.
Del Valle does a great job teaching Organic Chemistry. Even though he is not the course coordinator you will be adequality prepared for the exam with just his lectures.

If you can take Prof. Del Valle for Orgo, do it. He does such a great job of explaining the content in a way we can easily understand, and is very accessible to students outside lecture. Even though Prof. Miller's the one who runs the course, you never feel behind or disconnected in Prof. Del Valle's lecture. 100% recommend.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Best professor for Orgo. He describes concepts really well and he genuinely cares about students. The lectures are well-paced and recorded so they can always be watched back. He is also very funny and nice, really great person to learn chem from.

Great lectures, really enjoyed Professor Del Valle's class for Orgo 1. Great guy, made material simpler than the textbook, and office hours were really helpful. Definitely recommend reading the book before lecture and going to office hours when material is confusing, you will save a lot of time. Class material is brutal, but great professor.

Professor Topash-Rios is honestly one of the best professors that I've had.  She's smart and truly cares about the well-being of all her students.  Additionally, her grading criteria are clear. The class does require verbal participation, but you don't have to be 100% accurate as long as you get the idea across.  So, don't shy away.

She is the sweetest woman at ND. Tries to teach you the language, but also really cares about her students. I had her for Intermediate I as well, and in person exams dragged everyones grade down, but she is the best choice for Spanish at ND. Highly recommend. She is the best!!
Amazing professor. So nice and caring. Would recommend and take her again. She is just a really great person. Best choice for Intermediate I or II.

Not too high a load work-wise. Only big thing is quizzes/tests once every other week at the very least. She's willing to help in all situations and will prepare you for the test. As weird it may sound, she kinda reminds me of my mom. Nice woman and good choice for a Spanish class here.

Pannekoek is very experienced in corporate strategy and was quite successful, so he definitely knows what he's talking about. He uses current events and examples to illustrate corporate strategy which is very interesting. His tests are challenging and make you think critically. He is very kind and it is fun to pick his brain.

he seems to grade randomly and there is never a good reason behind the grades you get. we had four total assignments including a midterm and a final so theres not a lot of room to bring your grade up. a ton of readings too

Decent professor. Mandatory attendance and participation is required. Don't necessarily need to do readings but helps for participation. A lot of the class and grading seem kinda subjective and based on his personal opinions. If you answer the questions in the specific ways he wants, you'll do fine. Sometimes the assignments are not super clear.

He assigns a lot of reading for the class, but not from a textbook. He has certain criteria that he wants for each assignment that feels subjective. If you know what he wants, you will do a great job.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Not much inspirational thing, just about sharing his past experiences and making unnecessary implicit judgments about some countries that he doesn't like. He is a tough grader overall. Rubrics are unclear, grades relying simply on his personal judgment.

Prof. Pannekoek's int. management class was interesting and relatively easy. The tests are weighed pretty heavily, so you need to read the textbook and use the lecture material to do well. Attendance isn't mandatory, but it benefits you to show up and participate. Overall, it was a pretty easy class as long as you pay attention.

Dr. Morgan was so caring and wanted her students to succeed, however she was not a good lecturer. Lectures were just reading off of power points with no explanations of complex topics. Grading policy was very fair with lots of opportunities to make up points. Concept checks were helpful, but a hassle and too heavily weighted.

She is a really nice person and does want you to succeed. She is really bad at lecturing though. She basically reads straight from the book. It is a struggle to stay awake for her lecture. She sped through mechanisms without really explaining anything.

Dr. Morgan is a caring professor with two priorities. First, that you are doing ok as a student and human being. Secondly, that you are grasping the material. Some lectures are easier to follow than others and there are many resources to practice, get help, and constantly review material. Great professor, very adaptable to help you succeed.

Dr. Morgan is a wonderful person, but her lectures are not the best. She teaches directly from the online textbook, so do not bother reading. I will say, she gives extra credit opportunities in exams and class so there is opportunity to gain points back there. Fair exams, fair homework, good professor!

I had Todd Taylor for Moreau, and he was the best Moreau professor I could ever ask for. He is a very easy grader, but more importantly, he genuinely cares about each and every student and he makes an effort to get to know everyone.

Absolutely love Taylor! Great lecturer, very approachable, and deeply invested in developing and helping students as future professionals. Class-wise: the consistent, assigned group provides experience with collaboration and leadership, and the content explains how companies operate and the corporate mindset/view. 100% recommend summer study abroad

This is my second review for Todd (and Mike). They are amazing. For the Advanced class, it is a lot less learning than the Intro class. The Capsim project was very fun and useful to implementing the information learned in both classes. The key is to meet with them outside of class to review strategy. They are the best.

Todd (and Mike Kitz) are simply the best. Their class has outright been my favorite at ND. I cannot say enough good things about them. The only thing is if you are looking for an easy tech elective, this might not be the one. There are a lot of group projects that require meeting. The class is pretty easy, but can be a decent amount of work

I absolutely loved his immunology class, and he inspired me to continue my studies in that field. I enjoyed going to class each day and was excited to study the material. The course is definitely a bit challenging, but if you study the powerpoints and pay attention in lecture you will be completely fine. Great professor!

Professor Schorey is a great lecturer and really cares about the material he teaches. He's enthusiastic about it and is always willing to help students master their skills in immunology. I would say that the biggest thing is that the TAs grade hard, but he's willing to meet with you to discuss your grades.

Great guy, makes the material somewhat interesting. Tough grader on assignments. Docks students a big number of points who know clearly understand the material, but don't have time to explain every little detail. Quizzes are online but are somehow harder than the in-class final exam. Not a great lecturer and whizzes by important concepts.
A bit boring
Amazing and brilliant prof - one of the best at Notre Dame full stop.

Professor Martin is an excellent teacher. She is kind, caring, and extremely personable. Her class was interesting and thought-provoking. You could tell she genuinely cared for all of her students and was very passionate about her work. Cannot recommend her enough!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Inspirational--Accessible outside class

comment: prof martin is one of the best! this class is participation based with lots of readings but trust me its all worth it. shes a phenomenal writer and genuinely cares about her students. would recommend her class to anyone.

Really sweet & Inspiring professor. Genuinely cares about her students. Definitely a reading/writing intensive course, but she helps students break it down to size. She's incredibly intelligent and makes students feel at east. She's never judgmental or makes students feel awkward about their point of view. Her class encourages growth!

Made an otherwise dull subject interesting. Very personable and able to maintain my attention.
Provided more conceptual, and less technical, explanations of concepts, which I found to be really helpful. Couldn't have asked for a better Metrics teacher

Professor Fernando is a great professor, and did not leave any students behind when explaining
topics in class. He provided many opportunities to gain extra help, and made sure that topics
students had a harder time grasping were explained more in depth. This helped me do well in
this hard course, and I was very pleased with the way he conducted it
One of the worst professors I've ever had. Avoid if possible
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Prof Fernando keeps anxiety low, treats everyone with respect, is fair with the grading, and gives the students responsibility and respect freedom (no attendance required), while being available for support. What more do you want?

His syllabus has a dedicated +-10% grade for how much he liked you. He didn't disclose any grading criteria for final grades -- never releasing the final exam scores. Students were kept completely in the dark all semester regarding grades. Also, he is extremely condescending with cold calls and won't explain why students are wrong -- simply says no

Professor Fernando may be the most condescending individual I have ever met. He constantly talks down to students and cold calls in a way that seeks to embarrass as many people as possible. He also speeds through his slides, skipping over any difficult content while telling students to learn that material on their own (why even have the class?)
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: He's hot and cold, some lectures are clear, entertaining and helpful, and some are terrible. Cold calls people too so beware of that. Homework is really hard, and quizzes are graded harshly (he's a stickler for very specific answers). Liked the class overall even though I feel my grades didn't reflect my learning.

Prof. Magnan-Park is an insufferable academic snob with more demonstrated interest in keeping up scholarly appearances than in meaningful pedagogy or constructive assessment of outcomes. Condescending, inconsiderate, strange.
He's not a bad guy if you get to know him.
No Comments

This guy is really weird. He is not very helpful and individual grades on his essays are based on whether you are capable of reading his mind and writing exactly what he wants (because he won't tell you). He is occasionally funny but rarely informative. My advice is to not raise your hand in his class because he will shoot down anything you say.
Nice guy. Funny. He really went out of his way to help me when I took the class, so I'm biased. However, he'll go out of his way and not make you feel weird--as long as you do the work.
Good guy. obviously loves teaching. Doesnt use the text that much tho. Very funny and fun lectures and makes things clear. makes sure everyone understands before moving on.
So super friendly and good at explaining ... im gonna miss mr. J. next semester.
Very funny and is always willing to help.  You can tell he loves teaching.

This class is great for those who like science but no enough to major in it. Honestly just read the powerpoints and the know the info on them and you'll do fine. Not to mention the opportunity for extra credit in this class. It is a fun class that isn't much of a workload and if try you can get a good grade.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great class although I was overwhelmed at first with the amount of information on the powerpoints. The class grade is based on three test grades and a presentation. Definitely worth taking, it is a fun class with experiments and everything that is on the test you can find on the presentations and if it isn't she is willing to hear your case.
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: This chemistry class takes on the fun and historical aspects of the science that you might not see in a General Chemistry course. There is one demo for each class which helps make the lectures that much funner. The final for this class is a presentation which helps relieve stress from other finals because you are done with it earlier on.

Amanda Hummon in Foundation of Chemistry, teaches relatable material in an extremely fun and interesting way. There is one Demo per class and the final exam is a presentation. Definitely recommend this class to those interested in Chemistry and why its relevant in the world/history but don't want to suffer in Gen Chem. Loved this class!

I have nothing but good things to say about Professor Gezelter, he explained concepts and problems with such efficiency and clarity that even I as someone who does not understand chemistry understood. He was also available outside of class to help and when I was struggling with problems he explained them in a way that made them simple.

Professor Gezelter is simply an amazing instructor. He is able to explain complicated topics in simpler ways and provides a great number of additional learning resources. He is also very patient when explaining something and is always open to answering questions.

Professor Gezelter is hands down one of the best gen chem professors at Notre Dame. He is absolutely understanding and empathetic towards his students. Though the class itself is not very easy, Professor Gezelter truly makes sure his lectures are manageable.

He is a very charismatic and engaged professor. I could always tell that he was truly interested in what he was teaching us and that is greatly appreciated. I have no complaints at all I absolutely adore him. He made chemistry fun!

She's fine but you learn just as much from the slides as you do from class. There is no real point in going other than to get proofs, but those are in the textbook. The exams are also super hit or miss- either straight from the problem sets or random info that came up once for 30 seconds and never again. Literally ANYTHING could be on the exam

Extremely boring lectures, material is very difficult already but she makes it worse and more confusing. Long and difficult problem sets due almost every week, exams are slightly easier but still hard.
She might be the most boring lecturer in the whole school.

I cannot say enough good things about Professor Wu. She is incredibly organized and clear in her expectations. She is a great lecturer and does a phenomenal job of explaining complex economic concepts. If you pay attention to her lectures, you will learn a lot and do well. Very approachable, but does not really try to get to know students.

He is a good teacher who tries to make lectures enjoyable with jokes. However, I didn't care too much for the lectures because they were basically the same as the pre-class readings. However, he's an okay teacher who cares about your success.
Chilcote was really nice, the class itself was flipped-classroom so going to class kind of felt like a waste of time. The class isn't too bad, especially if you've taken AP Physics in high school

Professor Chilcote is pretty cool. The homework can be a lot for each class if you actually decide to do all of the readings (it's most definitely possible to get through the reading quizzes without them). His physics class is flipped-classroom, so readings about topics are done outside of class and then class time is spent going over examples.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: This class covers a wide range of subjects, with a heavy initial focus on classical mechanics. Your grade is based entirely off of homework and tests. Hes very accessible outside of class if you need help on the material and is responsive to mid-course feedback. His lectures are okay and he has a good sense of humor.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Test heavy

comment: A bit on the quirky side. Lectures are 50/50.
Extremely easy to connect with over discord, always available to connect in person or answer questions online. Very funny in class, reminds me a lot of Michael from V-Sauce, I liked his engagement.
accessible outside class via discord but few official office hours and no TAs. lectures a bit convoluted and exams are very difficult.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: Prof. McMillan is always willing to help and is very responsive outside of class time. He truly wants his students to succeed. The class can be challenging at times, but if you keep up with the daily homeworks and go to lectures, you will learn a lot. He keeps lecture material interesting by incorporating different topics and is super funny!

Professor McMillan is truly so caring and supportive of his students. He responds to your questions almost any hour of the day within 30 minutes. His input is extremely helpful and if you put effort into the class, he returns that effort. The class is difficult, but if you pay attention in lecture and keep up with the homework, you will learn a lot
While he is a very quiet guy which can be difficult during lectures, he is a genius. He is also very helpful and nice! I had him for Calc III and I was happy with him.
Super super sweet guy (he's also a genius). I do think he sometimes overcomplicates things and his lectures can make the material more confusing than it really is. Not a bad professor though.
Insanely talented while also being insanely good at explaining and drawing (very helpful for Calc 3). You cannot go wrong with O'Dorney

O'Dorney basically just lectured and wasn't anything special. The occasional joke, but he mostly lectures and does examples. I'd recommend some small studying of the topic he'll teach the next day, because typically he'd do a quick overview of the topic and then get right into examples. Class was fine, the guy is clearly a math genius

Top-notch professor. Understanding and cares about students' learning, is not a stickler on grades. Stops to deal with even basic issues which is rare with French teachers/profs in my experience. You won't regret taking her class.

Took Intermediate II with her. Great professor and such a caring person. Learned a lot of French grammar, though not much vocabulary. The class can get boring at times, but she's fair with grading. No final exam, would be good to speak more in class. Overall, a great professor—take her!

Professor Reising's class reinspired my love for French- she is one of the nicest professors I've ever had, and her classwork is engaging and thought-provoking without being overwhelming. Would LOVE to have another class with her!

Professor Reising is easily one of the nicest professors that I have taken while at Notre Dame. She is incredibly thoughtful, helpful, and interesting to speak to. I found her lectures to be helpful and really understandable in French. I thought the work was manageable and useful for improving my French abilities.

A fantastic professor that made tackling a foreign language fun. Dr. Reising gave clear feedback on all papers and exams while being very accessible via office hours and email. She makes sure to reserve time to speak to each student in the class, and speaks French at an understandable pace. Great sense of humor too--TAKE HER CLASS!

Prof. Reising leads an organized and fun class. She does a great job of teaching those that have no French experience and those that did take high school French concurrently. The class does require effort, but it is definitely possible to get a good grade regardless of how much prior experience you have with French. Take Prof. Reising's class!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: TAKE. RUDY'S. MOREAU. I promise, you will love it and have a much better Moreau First Year Experience than many of your peers. The class is discussion graded, we normally do not do as much writing as the other courses, but you need to be prepared for discussion to get points. Rudy is genuinely one of the nicest profs I've met here!

Rudy is a great Moreau teacher and cares deeply about Notre Dame. Very informational and a great guy. Actually grades parts of the class so more difficult compared to some teachers and not someone to take if you are going to put in 0 effort, but good guy to get to know.

Rudy was about as passionate as one can get regarding Notre Dame. Very caring guy that emphasized participation in class and preferred class be discussion rather than lecture. Grades harder than some other Moreau profs but if you put in adequate effort you will be very satisfied with your grade. Also gives a few days off for Notre Dame events.

He's a very nice guy and is super passionate about Notre Dame. He's the perfect Moreau prof. It is super easy to talk in class (even as an introvert I feel comfortable talking in class). He grades well, so if you put in the effort and try to connect with the material you will do fine. He truly cares about his students.

Professor Kirby is one of my favorite professors so far. He explains difficult concepts with clarity and precision, and he is very caring about his students. You can expect a lot of work, but I felt very prepared headed into exams.
Very good lecturer. Keeps students engaged with his great attitude and makes Physics 2 very digestible. Also loves showing off his little dog and making jokes.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: The lectures are really helpful for preparing for exams and he has a good personality.

Professor Kirby by far has been the best Physics Professor I have ever had, his lectures are amazing and he explains the content so well. The class is Engineering Physics E and M, so it is difficult content, but he does a great job explaining things and does tons of practice problems. Always posts notes and lecture slides, so you can miss a class.

Works really hard, very easily available. Wants her class to succeed and you will be prepared for exams. Honest, straightforward. Moves fast on material but that's the nature of the course. Can be abrasive but largely a sympathetic professor, you'll be very grateful to have been in her class.
She will prepare you for tests, especially if you seek help in the Math Help room outside of class. You will be well prepared.

Professor Houtz is great! She has a straightforward teaching style, posts her notes, is accessible outside of class, hosts review sessions, and has a great sense of humor. Her students' exam average was consistently higher than the course-wide average and she always had a positive and compassionate attitude in class. Definitely recommend!
From her interaction with others, you can tell she is arrogant, though she tried really hard to hide her personality. The class is easy A, no matter who teaches though.
She is very accessible to receive help which is great. She makes exit tickets to help our class practice the concepts and leads review sessions that are very helpful in preparing for exams.
HE IS A GOD! I LOVE HIM!!!!!! Good lecture I like his ideas when he talks! He is a very interesting man and a genius!!
Good lecturer and obviously a very smart man. Seemed a bit set in his opinion but at least was relatively patient with other view points. I can't say I loved the class but I learned so many things
Great man!  Everyone should take his class

Whatever brilliance Prof. Buttigieg may have, his screed against every ideology not patently his undermines the quality of his course and makes his occupation as a critic a schoolboy playground for name-calling and finger-pointing.

Class is only for those who took AP calc in high school. If you haven't taken calc before, good luck. Prof doesn't explain concepts  and accent makes understanding very hard. He teaches like we all have a PhD. There are 3 lengthy homeworks a week.The online quizzes are also bad, and mark anything w/ typo as wrong, and he doesn't double check them.

Yikes. He is a nice guy but would not recommend taking class with him. His lectures make the material 10x harder than necessary and he calls on students relentlessly. His accent makes communication hard and he takes roundabout routes around fairly easy concepts. For a math class based around simple concepts this class has a gross amount of work

English is not his first language so he is often difficult to understand. He's funny and entertaining but he singles kids out which is uncomfortable. Tried to get help outside of class and he wasn't very willing to answer my questions. He teaches from his own textbook and forgets that not all of us are math professors

Terrible lecturer; makes the topic way harder. With that being said, the course is easy and the guided notes available on the website help. Problems on homework/quiz/tests come straight from guided notes. Half of what he says you wont understand. He talks away from the class. He doesnt take attendance, so a good class to skip.
literally the kindest professor ever!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: Burns does not screw around when it comes to participation. She expects you to come to class having done the reading (which are almost always on a social or political issue) and prepared some kind of talking points or questions to share with the class, which means more work, but also some really fun discussions.

Burns was the best. Although we had papers (duh, it's a writing class), they are pass/fail at first, and only actually graded on how well you revise them all at the end of the year. She is very caring and kind to all of her students and really just a great professor and person.

Burns is really good at using student feedback about her class. She is a really good professor and it is my favorite class to go to all week. Not too much work and not too difficult of a class grade wise.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Lectures were incredibly boring and the exams were extremely difficult.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: All of his lectures are screenshots from a google image search of the topic he is teaching. Exams are difficult and the class has a low average, but you can get an A if you cram the info the night before.

Pros: Interesting lectures and a very knowledgeable professor that is accessible outside of class

Cons: Exams are definition heavy from the textbook, papers are group projects, hard to reach by email
Most dry professor but the class is easy and workload isn't bad at all

16 weeks of lectures that he talks for the entirety of the class period. I'd imagine 85% of the class isn't/can't follow by week four. Exams are harder versions of anything you've done on homework or practice exams. Avoid.
Lectures are incredibly hard to follow
Great professor

He gave our class 4, 24 hour take home midterms which were the most difficult exams I've ever taken in my life. I spent about 18 hours on each one. His lectures are so dull, and he makes it impossible to pay attention. He didn't give any HW for our class though, but 4 times a semester, he screws you over with a very very hard exam.
Foundations of Strategy - absolutely loved Michel. Average class all the way around. Would recommend

Michel is a nice guy, especially if you take the time to go to his office hours. His Foundations of Strategy class is run way different than others because he uses an online simulation. It honestly makes it easier to learn but you are competing with other groups in class. Study hard for the final and you should be fine.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: This is a review for Foundations of Management. Michel is very passionate about the class and seems to have alot of industry knowledge and experience. Class itself was only graded on participation(20%), a simulation run with a group (~30%), a couple brief papers, and a final(~30%).
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: Took him for foundations of strategy. Super smart guy with a lot of industry knowledge. partially my fault, but never did any reading (assigned random 40 page pdfs before every class), and had to study a lot for the final because didn't retain much during the course. large part of your grade is online simulation of a business that you runwithagroup
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: I really enjoyed Michel's class. I had him for both Strategic Management and Foresight. Most of the time, the assigned readings and case studies were relevant and interesting. He also does a really good job of connecting with students and making them comfortable to share ideas in class. He also has a few dad jokes that kept everyone entertained.

Definitely my easiest class of the semester. Prof. Sunshine wanted her students to succeed. As long as you complete all the homework (took less than 30 mins to complete) and put decent effort into the two essays, you will get an A. Highly recommend taking Prof. Sunshine.

Gem of a woman. definitely the best prof for foundations. She will give you an A if you put in effort but she also organizes the class very well. fantastic at engaging students and very knowledgeable. QUEEN SUNSHINE 4EVER. if you went to catholic school you'll literally get a 100. but best class for ppl with minimal knowledge ab catholicism

I've never been a big fan of theology, but I truly enjoy her class. While spending little time outside of class, I have learned a lot about the material. She is perfect at balancing the workload and ensuring you walk out of each class knowing more about theology than before.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: She's a really nice teacher which wants you to succeed. Her course itself is a little lower on the difficulty side, but you still need to put your work in. If I could give a 2.5 as a difficulty rating I would. Would recommend if you don't mind a bit of reading!

She was a new professor, so she wasn't good at explaining things at all. I assume that she will get better as time goes on because she is really smart and clearly knows what she is talking about, she just gets confused when explaining it. Most of the class is doing in-class problems instead of lecturing. Students teach more than she does.

Professor Sabety truly adapts to the needs of every student. She tries to make sure that everyone gets the most out of her lectures and readings. She is very attentive to what is happening in the classroom and cold calls to assert that students have understood. Her course creates a fun learning environment for students.

Great and caring professor. Having taken micro in high school, I came into the class knowing most of the material, so it was not too hard. However, I feel like she often overcomplicated things and struggled to explain the material. She made up for it in different ways, and as a new professor it will come. Would recommend :)

Prof. Sabety is a great person- super nice and caring, but not the best teacher. She gets confused when explaining things, and lets her students do most of the teaching. She's just TOO smart that she can't explain the entry-level course well. She gives extra credit and brought in presenting panels, but I would definitely recommend reading the text.

Professor Roycroft is amazing! She's kind and wants her students to feel welcomed and enjoy the class. She goes above and beyond by doing things like bringing her students snacks, which is appreciated. Moreau is an easy course, and she didn't do anything to make it unnecessarily complicated. If you do your assignments with effort, you'll be fine.

Professor Roycroft was truly a kind and caring professor. She made sure her students felt valued, heard, and respected. She constantly offered her help and guidance to make the transition into college life much smoother.
She is the best Moreau professor! It is evident she cares a lot about her students, brings snacks to every class, and is willing to help you through the class in any way she can.

Anne Roycroft is the best Moreau teacher! I had the privilege of having Anne as my Moreau teacher and she definitely made the college transition easier. Every week she brought food for someone's birthday, took us on field trips, or offered to drive us to places if we were without access to a car. She is an incredibly kind and generous woman!!
He makes seemingly boring topics super interesting by encouraging class discussion and having engaging lectures- also gave great, thorough feedback on writing assignment!

Professor Anderson was incredibly helpful, easy to contact, and an engaging lecturer. I think his class was the most beneficial writing course I've taken so far. However, he insisted on displaying all his due dates in Mongolian Standard Time, which I found quite odd...

Prof. was amazing and very engaging. Eccentric and engaging guy. Looked forward to his classes and when he would read his pieces. I grew as a writer as we explored the bounds of the essay. I highly recommend taking this class, though was a bit confused when he'd show up in fairy wings "bippity, boppity, boo-ing" my head when I got a right answer.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Inspirational

comment: Professor Anderson was an exceptional writing and rhetoric teacher. His feedback was consistently insightful, helping me refine my writing skills. What stood out was his unwavering dedication to his students' success. Always approachable and ready to offer guidance, Professor Anderson created a supportive learning environment.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Although he is incredibly passionate, this is NOT an intro course, you are expected to either have a good foundation or make up for it with 50-100 page readings from all the work he assigns. The course is supposed to be a lecture with time to discuss as a class but never worked out that way. Grading is not transparent at all, do not recommend.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Great professor, clearly very knowledgeable and passionate. Discussion based class, super interesting if you read and participate. Papers aren't too bad if you do the assigned readings and pay attention in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: This is a review for the MODERN INDIA AND PAKISTAN. get ready to read 30 pages per source, he usually assigns 3 sources that he expects you to come to class knowing everything in those pages. class is 90% lecture and hes literally just talking AT the class. end of semester final is just a paper but class itself is L would not take this guy again.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Professor Shivram is clearly very knowledgeable about the subject material and leads great discussion. If you're looking for an interesting USEM, this is a good option.

Professor Milenkovic's teaching methods are highly ineffective, making lectures a waste of time. In this advanced algorithms course, she repeatedly fails to clearly explain concepts, making simple ideas unnecessarily confusing. With no extra credit, vague exam guidelines, and an absence of support, its best to steer clear of her classes altogether.

I took a Discrete Math class my sophomore year of high school and I honestly think I learned more in that class. While her explanations of the material aren't great, the class is manageable so long as you're very detail-oriented. Getting very small things wrong can cost you a lot of points, especially in the first half of the class.

Professor Milenkovic is very kind and intelligent, but seems to focus more on the specifics of notation rather than understanding of skills and concepts while grading assignments and exams. Very personable and cares a lot about the subject, but at times lectures can become very dull, this was mostly due to a less than exciting subject matter.

Professor Milenkovic is ok at best for explaining things which is a rather important characteristic to have for a class that sets the foundation for logic in computer science. Study hard, and don't allow any opportunity to have points taken off because you won't ever have the opportunity to get them back. The tests aren't too bad, at least.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Excellently guided me through the entire dissertation process - problem statement, literature review, approach/method, data interpretation, recommendations, conclusions, etc. He is amongst the best Professors I have ever had.
Amazing - clear classes, very helpful. Well organized syllabus & valuable presentation of alternative to dominant economic perspectives/political economy.
Amazing - clear classes, very helpful. Well organized syllabus & valuable presentation of alternative to dominant economic perspectives/political economy.
Best prof I have ever had....hands down.
Class is always one really long tangent which has nothing to do with what you read but papers determine the entire grade and are easy enough

Horrible. Don't take him. His lectures have almost nothing to do with what the assessments entail, and he spends valuable class time talking about nonchalant stuff. Textbooks horribly written like riddles, almost impossible to understand what the textbook questions asks for. Online platform difficult to use. Unreasonable hardships for 300 course.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: His logic class is brutal. The midterm and final aren't worth a lot of your grade but are extraordinarily difficult. You will likely be unprepared for them. His lectures are very difficult to digest, and the homeworks can often be very difficult. However, he holds times to work on these homeworks with him or a TA, which are very helpful.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Franks earnestly cares about his class, but he oftentimes goes on tangents that take up more than half of the class. There are three papers to write, but they determine your entire grade. There's no pressure while writing them, but if you don't take them seriously, you will not get the grade you probably deserve.

A lot of poor reviews but I liked his class. Workload is kind of heavy, but if you do the work and put thought into it, it will go well. Fr. Terry knows what he talking about too; easily learned more philosophy from him than from any of my philo classes. Bottom line is that if you care about learning you should probably take his class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Between the sheer lunacy of the Tree Project staring aimlessly at dry leaves for 15 min every Friday to riding my bike around campus everyday for a month searching for the moon like a nic addict scrounges for their Geekbar, can't bring myself to endorse Terry. Singlehandedly tripling deforestation in Indiana from the readings printed everyweek too.

Fr. Terry is a great guy but I would only recommend his class to people with a genuine interest in both Theology and Ecology. He is very passionate about it and expects a lot of commitment from his students. He assigns both tests and papers, so if you like the topic take the class, but he will work you.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: His lectures are long and can be very dull. Readings are also so long. His grading is just extremely harsh and his advice in office hours is always very general so doesn't help that much. He's a nice guy but definitely just wish I had taken nuptial or something else.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Behrens was a great lecturer who clearly enjoyed teaching the material. Much of the struggle in the class was due to the difficulty of the exams, rather than poor teaching of the material. Behrens also made himself quite available outside of class to help out if needed.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: He is very compassionate and cares about students. I was initially in Taylors class but went to Behrens' lecture instead. Sometimes goes on tangents and proofs but has some helpful examples. Overall class seems easy because you can retake tests up to a 100, but average of the final test was a 68.

Handwrites all his lectures and makes sure you can get everything down, which is very helpful for Calc 3. Goes in-depth to answer any question asked in office hours or class and sometimes even finds time at the beginning of lectures to go over these tougher topics. His practice tests posted on Canvas and on his personal website prepare you well.

Nice guy and he cares about his students. His lectures are well-done and contain all the information, but they can get dull. He really likes proofs, but it doesn't draw away from his lectures. Sometimes gets a bit lost in the sauce. Nice dude, would take again.

Calc 3 is easy bc of the standard grading, so this review does not reflect that. Behrens cares about his students, but his lectures are all over the place and hard to follow. He regularly goes over and teaches through confusing proofs that do not apply to the questions we are tested on.

every calc 3 class takes the same tests, so the tests weren't rlly a factor in my rating. Behrens is a very smart guy, and if you can keep up with him, he's probably great. but he did too many proofs and difficult examples in class that i couldn't understand him very well. great prof if you're a fast learner, i'm just not
Behrens is a pretty funny guy, and he made the class pretty enjoyable. He always answered questions very well and made sure that everyone was understanding the lecture.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: He can definitely go off on tangents, but, he is a sweet guy. The class if fun if you participate and have a good group. The assignments are straight forward and easy. Overall good class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Jech was prone to go on awfully boring tangents. He forced us to read a book that he wrote, but would not admit that he wrote it. It was terribly boring and convoluted. If you are going to have students read your own work, at least make it good. He is a big fan of Kirkegaard, but he never explained his philosophy well.

He's awesome. Prof. Jech tells a lot of stories, and for the most part they relate to the material, but they're so entertaining. I took him for USEM Phil, there were 3 total assignments and one final paper. There are a bunch of readings and they're pretty difficult, but Jech is very good at explaining them and getting to the bigger picture.

Great, quirky guy. Knew he would go on tangents so he had a student time them and cut him off so he could get through the material. He cares a lot about his students. You have to read, but definitely take his class.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: I took Ken's Cost Accounting class back in 1977 and exchanged emails with him a couple of years ago. Now, I mostly remember my admiration for Ken as a caring teacher during all my years at ND, notably in my Senior year. It is telling that of all the professors I had contact with at ND, his name is the only one I remember. God bless You!  Matt W.

Prof. Milani is genuinely one of the nicest professors at Notre Dame. However, I found his accounting course quite difficult, especially the exams. I would try to take Hums if you can, but Milani is still a good option. Also,all the exams are open-notes, which is nice.

Ken Milani is one of the best professors I've ever had. He's very patient and has a deep love for teaching. As a professor of 40+ years, Professor Milani is going to be an ND legacy. Fair warning: He's a HUGE Cubs fan.

Ken Milani is one of the best professors at ND. Not only has he been teaching for almost 40 years but he has also retained his sense of humor and commitment to his students. He will help you with any question you ever have. He gives tough tests, but it's because she lets you keep your notes. Such a nice guy, funny and caring. One of ND's finest!

I enjoy Biochemistry and think its cool, but somehow Huber's style of teaching takes out all of the fun from it. I'm not sure if I was doing it wrong, but despite all the cramming for exams, its hard for me to say that I can recall anything from lecture. Super memorization heavy. This class was also unhelpful for the MCAT, very little overlap.

His lectures were extremely difficult to understand. He might as well be teaching in Russian. The textbook made more logical sense than what was said in class. Be prepared to teach yourself everything and still do poorly on the exams.

The course is lecture heavy and uses images from papers. Though, he does not necessarily give you those papers and all information is given while in class. As per the last comment, he may forget to record the lecture.

If you can avoid taking a class with him, I highly recommend that. Your grades are mostly determined by the tests, and it's almost impossible to study for them. He has powerpoints for his lectures, but they only have images from papers on them. If you miss a lecture, you'll be lucky if he remembered to turn on the audio for the recording.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: she is my favorite professor i've taken in the spanish major
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: Professor Miseres led the most interesting Spanish class I have ever taken and you could tell she was passionate about the topic. She provided all reading materials. We had a lot of interesting guest speakers, especially authors, which made this class stand out to me. She prioritizes our understanding of the readings and participation is mandatory.
I have Professor Miseres for my Honors Seminar class. She is such a great teacher and kind person. Always very enthusiastic about what we're learning in class. Highly recommend.

She gave very interesting and engaging lectures. She did a lot of activities to make class more interactive, but these activities created a lot of work in the class that often seemed like busy work. Lots of papers.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: I really was not a fan of Brodeur's course, but he's a really nice, likable guy who gets the most unfortunate haircuts. Be ready to do a lot of work outside of class to be able to understand the lectures. I found the lectures themselves immensely boring, though Brodeur does seem to genuinely love his subject.

Understands subject and can explain well. Nice guy and passionate. Well managed and organized. 2/3 hrs HW per week. Will happily clarify questions IF asked. Learning is done through reading textbook. Go to TA sessions for help with questions. Tough class if you have no prior exp. but this prof. makes it very easy if you work for it
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Get ready to read

comment: He doesnt really explain much, he just kinda breezes through examples and expects you to learn the topics in the books. His French accent doesnt help either. His lectures can be boring at times as well. However, he is a nice guy and he occasionally cracks a joke.

If you haven't taken physics before it can be hard to grasp the concepts because he moves pretty quickly past a lot of topics. I would definitely recommend him for people who have taken a good physics class before but not for people who haven't ever taken it. He is very fun and lighthearted, so class wasn't the worst.

Professor Bambrick is so smart and knowledgeable in her field. She gives amazing lectures and a lot of feedback if you just go to office hours and ask. Definitely a great professor and go to office hours so you can get feedback on papers before you turn them in. The grading is tough and seems a little arbitrary, so it takes some getting used to.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: A brilliant and caring professor. This seminar was difficult at times, but in the best kind of way where you leave as a much better questioner and writer (huge for law school). She took complex readings and presented them in a way which we could understand as undergrads, while using the socratic method in a fun way. Take her class!!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Accessible outside class

comment: Had Prof. Bambrick for her Comparative Constitutionalism Junior Seminar. The class was really interesting and the readings weren't bad at all for a political science class. She's very knowledgable about her subject and does a really good job explaining complex legal and theoretical topics to students.

An overall amazing professor! She is so kind and makes everyone feel welcome. The material is somewhat difficult depending on the person you are, but she teaches it in a way that students are better able to understand the material. Papers are graded a bit tough, but overall she gives amazing feedback and wants to help you learn!
Fantastic.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Cares about students and makes class interesting by letting students solve questions for money. Lectures are helpful to attend but not mandatory. Material online is not super organized but everything is there. Releases exam keys directly after the exams so you know how you did. Do the practice problems in the book AND in class.

Battalio really wants his students to do well, but the content can be very difficult to grasp, especially if you aren't a finance major. He does his best to be funny and make the class enjoyable. Your grade in the class is almost completely reliant on tests, but the class will typically be curved up in the end.

Battalio is a cool guy but he's extremely unorganized when it comes to class... answer keys on practice tests often have mistakes and example problem solutions are scattered everywhere. Grade is 100% reliant on exams which can be tricky. He tries to entertain you in class which is fun at times, but can get a bit old.
easy grader, fair amount of homework, cares about her students

One of best WR prof. Grades very easily and should get an A. Also, tries to do a good job of building classroom community which is nice. Only 3 papers all year and none were that difficult. Readings from the books aren't really required or tested upon. Advice would be to participate and go to office hours so she likes you.
She does too much in WRRH. It is not a chill class at all. We seem to focus on many different topics without going nearly in-depth enough on any of them.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Accessible outside class

comment: One of the best professors I've had. Super kind and very good at providing feedback for papers. She was also very nice about granting extensions for numerous assignments. As long as you put effort into your assignments and participate sometimes, you'll do fine in the course.
Super kind and caring.  Light workload in comparison to other writing and rhetoric courses.
Decent teacher, but the grading in the course was harsh.

Professor Ehren is a really good professor. You can tell she cares a lot about her students and wants them to get excited about engineering. The class itself is not too bad. There is a group project and an individual project, and there are two exams during the semester. Professor Ehren is readily available outside of class.
Sometimes a little hard to follow, but genuinely cares for students.
Super nice, she seems stressed out a lot but you won't have any problems with her as a professor.

Professor Troutner is very polite and understanding.  He love when you participate in class even if you disagree with him.  He is open for discourse on the topics he teaches and will explain different views on the subject.  His daily homework is usually pretty easy and his papers are never too daunting.
Amazing teacher
Heavy reading and heavy lecture course, but this is how 1st Theo goes. He is a fair grader and gives good feedback, helping you improve your theological writing if you ask him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Troutner is a really great guy. Lectures were sometimes hard to follow and there is a heavy amount of reading and writing to do, but that's just the nature of a theology class. Aside from the content and course itself being a bit tedious, Professor Troutner himself is a good professor, and would recommend him.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: Pretty tough class but the curve makes it so you can do pretty badly on exams and still get at least a B+. Flipped classroom so he just does examples on the board the whole time, he's really not great at explaining things and I usually did not understand much in the lectures. Funny and nice guy, but not great at teaching

He really knows what he's talking about, but does a poor job communicating it. Very hard to stay attentive in his lectures. Does not respect students' time and often starts a pop quiz 3 minutes before class ends. Make sure to attend class for pop-quizzes or participation things, though many "poll everywheres" were broken. Tough exams.
Gave very little time for in-class graded participation and put material on the final midterm that was never taught (half of the class failed).
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Really nice and really good lecturer. Posts lecture videos ahead of time. Recommend watching because he asks clicker questions in class and videos give you answers ahead of time. Get enough of those questions right and he just gives you 100% on the final. Make sure you go to class though to get those points.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: She's a pretty good teacher, and it's easy to get a good grade if you do the work. Her voice is incredibly annoying.
No Comments

She's brilliant.  If you want to learn to speak Spanish, take her intensive class.  It's probably more work than most of the other Spanish classes, but it is a worthwhile investment of your time.  You'll be better prepared for every other Spanish class.
Decent if you're good at Spanish, difficult if you're past teachers sucked.
Nauseating, self-righteous, anti-gay, and anti-women hypocrite.
Awesome prof.
No Comments
No Comments
Good.

Byzantine Art- 30213: I think it should be required to take this man's course for art history & classics majors.  He attended the Courtauld Institute of Art, has published extensively on practically every aspect of Byzantine image theory, and is pretty much an academic god. No textbook- journal articles! Class is quite challenging, but great!
really knows his stuff, and has an adorable British accent :)
Very friendly

looking back at my time at ND, I enjoyed all my professors, EXCEPT this one. awful. don't take any of his classes. I was stunned when I saw that he is now the dept. chair. hopefully that means less teaching on his part.

tries desperately to convince kids he's a high-class intellectual but in reality is pretentious, boring, and, to be honest, not anywhere near as bright as he attempts to signal (quick glance at his book ratings illustrates that). trolled him all semester, playing along with his highbrow nonsense to ace the class.
Jim is the best. Seriously, take his class, you won't be disappointed! He is funny and smart. Grades very very very easily.
Professor makes outward show of friendliness but can be viciously cruel to students, unnecessarily and sadistically so. :-(

I would not recommend this class. The only grading criteria were five multiple choice quizzes, which only had fifteen questions each. The wording of the quizzes was often confusing, and I ended up missing trivial questions asking about random details from readings/lectures. Also the lectures were not very engaging.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Whitmore is the best class. Not stressful at all. Quizzes are cake. And his lectures are incredible! 100% take him for a chill semester but with many great takeaways and lessons on how to carry yourself through life.
Todd Whitmore is my GOAT. Take this class for Theo 2.

5 quizzes count for 85% of your grade, and the rest is participation. He is a very good lecturer who explains certain subjects clearly and simply. Class is usually professional but relaxed. Course is not too demanding, but one should pay attention to the readings and the lectures if he or she wants to do well.

Professor Wolbrecht is smart and kind. Her lectures were clear and always accompanied by a slideshow. There is an online textbook with quizzes inside as homework, but they are open book and super straightforward. There are were a few short papers (3 pages max), but no exams. Overall, her class was easy and informative.
Good class.

Prof. Wolbrecht was super nice and funny during lecture- unfortunately, I really didn't get much out of her class.  I enjoyed the section meetings with my TA more than I enjoyed her lectures. Overall, really easy. The 'quizzes' are open-book and the essays are only 3 pages. Your grade depends mostly on your TA.

She is really funny during lecture but it was 100 students so she won't know you personally unless u ask to meet with her. Attendance isn't required except for discussion, and your main contact point and grader is going to be your TA. The essays had engaging prompts but were sometimes open-ended/confusing. no exams but writing heavy.

Dr. Chan is the BEST! Love her! Cog Neuro was so interesting and she gave so much extra credit. The exams are totally based off of lecture, so no need to read the textbook. The awe journals and collaborative readings are annoying, but help so much to pad your grade. This class is awesome and so is Dr. Chan. She cares so deeply about her students.

shes a great professor! class is very lecture heavy but shes a good lecturer and is passionate abt cognitive psych. the only thing i didnt love was the problem sets, bc some of the grading can be difficult (ex. if you select all but one correct, you get the whole thing wrong). but she herself is very nice and gives great feedback on your projects
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Chan really cares about your learning and when I took her class, she eliminated traditional exams and had us do consistent online evaluations. They were open book and application based. As long as you attend classes and pay attention, you'll do great. TAs are very helpful if you have questions on the online evaluations before the due date.

Dr. Chan is an amazing professor. She keeps lectures engaging and interesting. She is very accessible for help and wants you to succeed. Dr. Chan is very understanding of different circumstances and while there is a lot of homework, it all relates to the class and is important. Overall, would recommend to everyone.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: I love Dr. Chan! She is amazing, interesting, and cares if you succeed. I didn't do as well as I wanted to on my first exam and she agreed if I improved in the course that she would curve my grade. The class is fairly easy because of all the easy assignments and if you study for the exams you will do great!

Lengthy homeworks and repetitive information in lectures. Considering the class format, it could have been online but he instead makes you come with a quiz every class. Grading on homeworks needs improvement; missing one question deducts significantly more points in short assignments than long ones even though the difficulty of questions are same.

Condescending, not understanding at all, and extremely rude. He has an extreme power trip. I probably spend 6+ hours a week on homework, and there is a quiz every class. He is extremely unsympathetic and likes knowing kids spend countless hours on his class. His class is incredibly boring, and he does things in a way to optimize inconvenience.

I was very excited about his class and content, but man this guy just sucks the life out of the room when he talks. For some reason decides to grade things excessively harsh as if there is some benefit in that. So many other great profs at ND. Should've retired years ago. Doesn't give a darn about his students.  Don't waste your time with him.

Does not respect school disability services and requires you to break medical confidence to an extreme level to grant any kind of extension from it, when the purpose of the program is to keep confidential information confidential. Stay away.

Otherwise is not flexible. Really easy class that he grades harshly to make life difficult. Not friendly

Dr. A's class was great! We had 7 paper summaries (less than one page), 2 presentations, 2 exams, and the final was a lightning talk. Interesting topics that we had the freedom to pick. Classes often turned into more of a discussion rather than a lecture. My year, we had partner exams. This class definitely helped develop my presentation skills.

Dr. A is a good professor. I took his Daphnia lab last spring, and I was able to learn a lot. It is a lot of foreign concepts thrown at you all at once, but each week builds on the previous one, so there are lots of opportunities to review the material multiple times, and the TAs are helpful in explaining concepts. Overall, it was a fun lab.

Dr. A is a very nice guy. Young professor with good energy. His Daphnia lab section was very interesting, and he encourages you to think critically about the concepts. His Canvas is unfortunately disorganized, so it would be nice if that could be improved over time (unclear if there were concept checks, conflicting rubrics, etc). But good overall.

Dr. A is am amazing professor. He is very energetic in class, and really tries to get the most out his students. He tries to get them to think critically, but he won't leave anyone feeling lost. He does a great job at explaining difficult concepts. I enjoyed going to lab every week.

Professor Agrelius is inredible at listening to student feedback and making sure he is constantly adjusting his class to make it the best experience. He added on a lot of extra credit opportunities on the exams towards the end of the year. As a younger professor, I also feel like he is relatable in a way that some other teachers migt not be.

Now that it's all said and done and Major Taylor is enjoying a well deserved retirement on the coastal beaches of western Virginia, I gotta say, what a class. Major Taylor's story never ceased to inspire me and his humility in teaching a bunch of delinquent army Cadets despite his immense prestige is nothing but admirable.
Loved the class and loved major taylor. Be ready to be there the whole time because full attendance is super mandatory. He will never let you out early.

Great person, great lecturer, really solid professor. His military science class is not at all a walk in the park though. Weekly assignments require a meticulous reading of the material to receive even a passing grade. I would only suggest taking the MS1 class if you have a pretty extensive knowledge of military strategy and customs coming into it.

He captivated. His few southern infused words struggled to not burst from the abundance of the meaning they contained.  He illuminated.
