He is a rough teacher be ready to fail.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: I took Pricing Analytics with him, and really felt that I learned a lot. You have to submit a report every week based on a case study which are time consuming, but the professor is super helpful and can be easily reached by email or office hours. Heavy workload, but as long as you get everything done, you will likely get an A in the course.

Took him for Advanced Stat Inference as a course for MSBA. He is AMAZING! His lectures-easy to follow. He uses same codes in R repeatedly so you don't get confused. His deliverables: Lab work (which he discusses in class question by question), hw(which is exactly like lab) & assignment(which combines lab & hw).Exams - 90% same as deliverables. EASY
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Prof. Simon-Robertson is a really nice person, and super smart. She's good at answering questions. Some of the labs and instructions were a bit unclear, but as long as you go to office hours, the work is doable. Her grading scale is also really forgiving, the labs have regrades.

Matt is a good TA and understands math pretty well. He is excited about math and can explain it to students. He grades somewhat harshly, but hold office hours where he gives answers and works through problems with students. Solid guy.

Professor Chun was fantastic at inspiring interest in a very niche topic. Her USEM class involved a lot of reading and writing, but it was all very interesting. She is a very kind person and always willing to meet outside of class time if you need help with your papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: She puts a lot of effort into her lectures to make them engaging. The whole class is centered around a 3-step design process. She walks you through it on the first project and gives great feedback so by the third project it's second nature to you. Grades are based on the presentations/projects, no tests. Highly recommend it for business/engineering
Great professor. If you participate in class and do the assignments, you'll get an easy A. She is a great person and teacher, and I 100% recommend her.

Father Martin has to be my favorite professor of all time. I went into this class to fulfill the art requirement and ended up adding on a studio art minor. The vibe in the class is super chill cause Father Martin plays music, cracks jokes, and sometimes buys us food. My favorite memories from my freshman first semester are from this class.

Incredible prof, one of the best I've had in the History dept. One big (15 pg) paper, but she broke it down very well so that the students stayed on track. Also a 5 pg paper, but no exams at all. Super nice, great feedback on assignments, and super accessible outside of class. Would definitely take it again, even with the long paper!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Respectfully avoid him for Moreau. Pros: EXTREMELY nice guy and will give 100s on every assignment. CONS: He talks a lot and student interaction/participation was rare. Whole class was listening to him talk and talking with other students was limited. Classroom community was not there and that is the whole point of Moreau.

Professor Hamkins is one of the most respected professors among the faculty of the department. You can almost tell instantly that he is incredibly smart and imaginative. He seems to be on a different dimension than his students. His course content is covered in a very beginner-friendly way but also allows for learning for more studied students.

Easily the best TA I've ever had.  Phenomenal teacher, explains any and all concepts extremely clearly and efficiently.  I genuinely learned more from him in tutorial than I did from my professors during lecture.  Hosts review sessions in the Math Help Room before exams which are extremely helpful.  So badly wished he was my professor!
He is a good professor. The key is to engage in class; he wants to see students succeed and that means being an active participant in the class.

This was a very tough class but I learned a lot. Sophie is incredibly knowledgeable about the Private Equity field! I found that she was very accessible for help outside of class and her TA was equally helpful. I will say that this is one of the tougher Finance electives so if you aren't looking for a challenge then maybe stay away from this class.

Worst of the six Mendoza 4000 electives I've taken. Hardest final I've taken in Mendoza. If you go to class it's incredibly boring, but don't skip because small random details from class feature heavily on exams. Monotone and whitewashed class. I will say that she brings in speakers who actually have experience in PE and they're super interesting.

Professor Shive is an incredible professor! She is very intelligent and knows a lot about the private equity world and is really good at breaking down material and helping students understand difficult concepts. Definitely go to class! It's important to be there in person because she tests on stuff she talks about in class, even if covered briefly.
Hard paper grader but balanced overall

If you are premed and think this class sounds interesting, just don't. The content was interesting, but expectations for exams and papers were not clearly communicated, resulting in many premeds struggling in this class. This class caused me the most stress as a premed.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: In my opinion, Professor McQuillan was not a good professor for a USEM at Notre Dame, as he was not engaging, graded harshly, and there were very few grades in the class.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Absolute sweetie. Loves students more than anything. Only listen to me on this.

Prof. Sell was great!! The class I took with him was lecture-based but discussion was encouraged (& graded). The readings were quite long, but as long as you at least skim them you will be good. He provided great feedback on my papers when I asked! The class was graded on four short essays, a midterm paper, and a final paper. Definitely recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Padilla is a great! She cares a lot about her students and recognizes that they have a lot going on. She is very flexible with assignments and due dates. There are a few major assignments but she provides clear guidelines and good feedback.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Very chill professor who doesn't grade harshly, would recommend her as a Moreau professor.

Professor Huang is a super nice guy and very smart.  His teaching style is a little boring in my opinion.  He is very monotone and doesn't do a ton of demonstrations or practice problems. It was hard to stay engaged taking his class at 8am.  Class is difficult but manageable.

Professor Huang is decent. Its pretty difficult to teach physics so I can't really blame him. He does not explain what concepts actually are however and just does problems. Tests were pretty hard & spends too much time on derivations of things imo. Good curve at the end of the semester. I'd say he's still the better the other professor though.
I've taken multiple classes with Olivier Morel and I continue thinking about in-class discussions long after the classes have ended. Well worth taking.

I took his On the Road university seminar and loved it. There are reading or film assignments for each class, but they are always manageable. Discussion is fascinating. Grade is based on 4 main papers of varying length, always got great feedback on the papers. Did not get deductions for small errors, very encouraging and accessible.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Ok so this was the hardest class I've taken in my entire life, but I have never learned more in a class. You have to do the readings with extensive notes bc he does cold calls every class. he's an amazing lecturer and so intelligent. I would take a bullet for this man, but his grading policy is bs. you start at a 100 then go down

I took this course as an elective and this instructor doesn't teach anything.  He talks about things not related to the material and it is a waste of time.  If you want to zone out and get an easy A for an elective, then take him.  You can get other work done, use your computer, he doesn't care.  I got an A and never made an effort.

Miller was a great teacher, awesome guy to get to know. His lectures get extremely hard to follow after like ten minutes. I learned more in office hours with him and the TAs than I did going to class. The exams are brutal and the projects depend entirely on your group. Getting an A is possible, just read and go to office hours.

Otteson is a very engaging professor and teaches a great class. You learn about the morality of capitalism. MC questions on tests are pretty hard for no reason. Ex. "If this were true...then..". It's like the SAT all over again. Weekly reading quizzes aren't that bad, just pay attention. With the extra credit, an A is abt a 91.

Favorite class I've taken at Notre Dame. It's a fairly difficult class but he's so engaging and the lectures are so interesting that I didn't have to muster much motivation to study and do assignments. Would 100% recommend and wish I could take more classes with him

This review is for Why Business. Professor Otteson is a very engaging lecturer and the discussion groups and material are interesting. There are readings before each lecture, but they are relatively short. Simple reading quizzes every Wednesday. Class is mostly graded off of midterm (35%) and the final (40%), which are both MC + essay response.
Dr. Maziar is a great professor and really cares about her students. Her lectures are light and sometimes funny, but never boring. You won't regret taking her class!

She records all of her lectures and makes study guides for every lecture. Her exams are very straight forward with multiple choice, T/F, write the definition, and short answer. There is a lot of extra credit on homeworks and exams. She is not trying to trick you and lectures follow a logical order.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Wingert is THE BEST. While the content is not necessarily easy and there is a decent amount of information, she is willing to work with each student individually. You can set up appointments with her to go over content and homework. There is also a TON of extra credit. Take this professor, you won't be disappointed.
Does not provide clear guidelines and expects students to produce amazing work then takes points off because something is “missing” or “incorrect”

What I appreciated most about Professor Lemos is how clear she lays her expectations for the class. What she writes on the board, repeats several times in class, and puts on study guides is what she expects us to know—nothing sneaky. When we turn in our paper outlines, she gives good feedback and is happy to expand on it in office hours.
He was a TERRIBLE professor. Lectures were dry and boring. The tests were unfair. DONT TAKE HIS CLASS. fair warning.
I wish I could have her for Moreau again.
No Comments
Hard to understand. She can be very vague and confusing in lectures

Nothing's cumulative and there are no tests, but a lot of the grade is based on participation and doing the readings. There are two analytic essays and her final is optional to boost your grade. 99% of the class is in Spanish, so make sure you're proficient. Genuinely interested in the students. Half the class is run by students doing "moderations"
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Tests? Not many

comment: Very good moreau instructor. Grades very easily as long as you meet the minimum requirements. Allows discussions to flow nicely, and does not force students to participate.

Professor Fuehrmeyer is a traditional guy but he brings a lot to the table. He was a managing director for Deloitte Chicago so the guy definitely knows what he is talking about. He is very open about his experiences and will help in any way possible with interviewing/internships/etc. If you are an accounting major, I recommend taking his class
It was a fun class, but difficult. The Catholic Bible is you textbook. The tests were difficult because the material tested came from a wide array of potential questions.

Professor Judy was amazing in my opinion. She was very understanding of students. If you were struggling or stressed, she was willing to extend deadlines as long as you came to her for help before the due date. She facilitated class discussion very well. Anytime you speak, she really listens and makes you feel heard. There are no dumb answers.

She only speaks in Chinese the whole class, which would be helpful if we knew what she was saying, but it is tough when she uses phrases we don't know to explain the meaning of another that we don't know. You have to figure out how to avoid her asking you questions so you have time to figure out what is going on in class.

I enjoyed Professor Himelright's class. I really liked the way his lectures were structured and that he provided the PowerPoints for each class. I took Moral Problems with him, and most of the readings were interesting, relevant, and understandable. There are only three four-page papers, and they just asked to summarize one of the readings.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of the nicest guys ever. He was a super easy grader. The reading is optional. The class itself was kind of boring, but I would encourage you to sit through it because the class is an easy A. You get 2 extensions to use throughout the term.

He's not the best professor I've had, but not near the worst either. Taking his calculus class is probably a solid bet. He's not particularly engaging, but then again, neither is calculus, at least for me.

Not the most interesting lecturer (half the class regularly skipped), but a good grade is very doable. Whole grade is determined by 7 longish homework assignments, which weren't too hard especially if you go to office hours.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Professor Smith's neurobiology class is fantastic. Peer review mastery exams are the best system ever, and the content covered in the class is really exciting and novel. As a neuro major, I think this class is a must, and Professor Smith does a fantastic job putting it together.
Amazing professor and deeply interesting class. This class is intellectually stimulating and challenging...well worth the effort put in. Big fan of the mini labs!

Professor Clairmont gives extensive lectures for the entire meeting period. It can be boring at times, but his feedback and assistance are the reason you should take him. When it comes to writing the research paper or doing exams, following the rubric will help a ton. If you put in a solid effort, you should definitely get a B+ or above!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Prof. Andor is a pretty good lecturer, but she's definitely a tough grader. Just be wary of that.
A lot of reading
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: He is very kind and accessible outside of class. He made learning code enjoyable and I actually looked forward to going to class. Lectures are very engaging and he grades fairly.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Professor Wowak does an amazing job teaching process analytics. Every class is engaging and super interesting, and she does a great job using examples to facilitate learning. I would highly, highly recommend Professor Wowak. Very fair grader and simple homework as well! Just be warned, you must participate in class to get a good grade!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Avoid at all costs. If you are the type of student that relies on office hours and needs additional help, do not take a class of his. On top of being condescending, he simply does not teach well. He also is unwilling to accommodate to unforeseen circumstances (being very sick, etc.). Wouldn't recommend him to my worst enemy.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Luan is not only bad at explaining math, hes bad at English. This makes his class pretty dull. I would not recommend him if you have never taken calculus before because he breezes through he material. He does occasionally do kahoot however it does not make up for his teaching.

I have never sculpted in my life, but my effort is the reason I got an A+. I tried on my book work and made sure to detail my answers. Many of my projects were not that pretty, but I included the requirements and turned everything in on time. He will always help you with skills and ideas. Only problem is a lot of the class is waiting around, bored.

This was a hard class. He is a very smart man and knows a ton about the material. However, it is often hard to grasp what he says in lecture, but reading the material before lecture is very helpful. Tests are hard and are a guessing game as to whats on them. Usually based on tutorial questions and practice exams. He is a fair man, but tough class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Coulter is a good choice for Calculus A. Compared to other Calc A teachers, she is more engaged, easier to understand, and cares more about her students. However, she does move quite fast if you've never taken calc before. She also is pretty shy and while her confidence grew throughout the semester, she could sometimes be too quiet.

This is a great second philosophy class! Prof. Anderson is a great lecturer and makes philosophy exciting. He is very funny and engaging. To do well in the class, you have to do all the readings. The readings aren't very long- usually between 7 and 10 short pages. The grade was based on participation and two papers- 3 pages and 7 pages.

Terrible professor. She knew nothing about employment law of any value. Injects her super conservative views into the classroom for no reason. Spent an entire lecture talking about how minorities don't deserve what they get in this country. AVOID AVOID AVOID

Roya is fine. Lectures are boring and ALL of the content on exams is in the lectures, however, attendance is occasionally taken and DOES count towards your grade. Although I did not take stats in high school, I was able to follow along without seeking outside resources. Exams are multiple choice with a few partial credits.

This statistics course was not the hardest. The class was boring and attendance was mandatory, but you could tell Professor Roya gave it her all. She really cares about her students, and the material is not the most difficult. The tests can be a bit confusing, and the tutorial is can be annoying, but overall she was an amazing professor.

Professor Serrano is a very intelligent chemist. However, he seems to be either unable/unwilling to translate his skills toward teaching undergraduates. The homework assignments are unnecessarily difficult, and he sounds like he would rather be anywhere else when lecturing. His only saving graces are the easy exams and plenty of extra credits.

Professor Verdeja was my favorite teacher last semester. Despite teaching to a crowd of 100, he always managed to keep me engaged. The grading of papers is hard, but fair; there was nothing criticized that I couldn't fix the next time. Definitely take this guy, although probably not just for the credits.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Billet is a great guy, and his class is interesting. Basically the whole class is him telling stories about his time as a lobbyist. The class is a little disorganized and there really isn't a lot of structure to it, but it was enjoyable nonetheless. The class grade is determined by three papers. He isn't a tough grader, and is a hilarious guy!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Graded by few things

comment: Richard is a cool guy, but not as great of a professor. His lectures are completely off the cuff, with no powerpoints or outlines, and as such, he oftentimes is all over the place. It is extremely hard to follow what he says, and he contradicts himself quite a bit. I don't think I really learned anything in this class.

He is a very funny guy, really cares about his students, and is overall a great person. However, the homework is often ridiculously long, especially when it is a coding assignment. The exams are also very difficult. This class is challenging, but using his notes and examples from the book helps a lot with the homework and exams.

I honestly doubt any non-philo major/minor passed. It was incredibly hard and boring. Electronics were banned and the professor mumbled and wrote sloppy notes. If you did not know the subject matter, you would fail. Your final grade is based off of 3 in class essays (equal weight). I would never recommend this class to anyone.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Pierce was an amazing professor. He was very reasonable with grading and gave lots of opportunities to do well in his class. He was also very accessible outside of class, respectful of all questions, and made lectures easy to follow. Would take a class with him again.

Margaret is great and is very fair. She gives you a great set of lecture notes. Her tests, however, are very hard and determine 81% of your grade. The final was not cumulative. She had a crazy amount of office hours and wanted to see her students succeed. Homework was extremely easy (6 throughout semester, drop one). There was also 1 easy project.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: This class felt like two separate courses; The first and second half of the semester do not correlate whatsoever. The latter half (worth ~70% of the grade) is based on one paper on one artwork. There is no clarification about how your grade looks, and he is difficult to contact outside of class. He also changed the syllabus roughly every week.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I had Prof Dreyer for another course and this one, and he was always respectful of our time and wanted us to actually engage with the course material, which we did.

Prof. Marcus has high expectations, but she gives her students the support they need to do well. Regardless of a student's starting point, she pushes them to the next step in their growth as a writer. She's very nice and makes herself accessible to her students for help. Super cool person and great teacher.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Great professor and great class Prof. Visconsi challenges his students in a productive way and makes class enjoyable. I learned a lot of things that I continue to think about and reference. His assignments made you think and were fun to do. He got to know every student and encouraged them to play to their strengths in their final projects.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: Prof Noemi was great! She is a super fun and personable professor who genuinely cares about her students. She gives feedback on essays before you submit them and you will edit your lowest scoring essay at the end of the course (your grade will change). Most of the material is pretty interesting and you will learn a lot about the world and writing.

I adored Marcantonio's class. I took her for Italian Beginning 1 and loved the class. She made it fun and easy to learn the language. There is quite some homework, but it serves as practice and review for the test and assignments. She really cares about her students and wants them to succeed. I 100% recommend her and would take her class again.

Game theory is an interesting course but Prof. Rath's lectures are quite boring. Most learning is done outside of class, due to the help of the TAs, homeworks and exams are doable if you study effectively. Prof. Rath's biggest issue is that he is unapproachable and intimidating, as he sometimes snaps when people ask or answer questions in class.

Professor Rath is not really engaging and is hard to understand sometimes, but he teaches effectively and really cares about his students. His tests are not as difficult, but I would recommend going to the TA office hours as you'll probably be doing most of your learning outside the classroom.
She is a kind person but grades super hard for Moreau even though its supposed to be a one credit course...

Professor Cutting was the absolute best! Her lectures were super straightforward and reading the textbook helped reinforce everything that was said in class. Her exams were extremely fair. She was also always available to answer questions.

Professor Iorizzo was so loving and genuinely cared for all her students. Though, she does tend to ramble a lot and go off topic which makes it seem like there is no structure to the course. Often times, I found myself bored due to the randomness of her character but do as she says in class and you are guaranteed an A
He did a great job exposing his students to writing for the public good. The books we read touched my heart such as Hiroshima and Dead Man Walking. He was not a tough grader on papers.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Gives good feedback--So many papers

comment: not overly challenging but enjoyed course

As a person, Duffield is very sweet and understanding, but he is not the best lecturer. It didn't help that our class grade was only based on four exams (50 MCQ per exam). He would simply describe the images on each slide without really engaging the class, so it was hard paying attention. He does give a reasonable amount of extra credit, though.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Aland was pretty brutal in his first semester at ND. Had no feel for how Cost was meant to be taught and made it extremely boring. Real nice guy who is super relatable especially since he is young but I would wait as long as you can to take him so he can grow and mature as a professor.

I took Just Wage Research Lab with Professor Graff and I loved the class. He gives a lot of direction if you are confused with an assignment and he really cares about his students. We got snacks every single class. I wasn't sure what to expect, but the class is super interesting. I highly recommend to anyone who is interested. Effort = good grade.

Super interesting class, loved the Prof. I skipped 8 classes and still got an A. Prof Lu uploads lecture presentations and records all lectures (amazing). Case assignments are hard but are not graded super hard (choose your group wisely). There is no final only a midterm and final presentation. Essentially, your grade is determined by the midterm.
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Very passionate and enthusiastic about all things biology.  Cold calls groups of students during lecture but is very patient in directing students toward the correct answer.  Recommend attending her review sessions before each exam.  Really wants students to succeed and is very available outside of class to ask questions and seek studying advice.

Absolute worst professor I've ever come across, its clear he doesn't care about his students assigns atleast 70 pages of readings and at least 3 hours of viewings for each class, the stuff he talks about in class also makes no sense and is so unhelpful for the assignments.  The course seemed really interesting and has potential but isnt done right.

One of the easier USEM's compared to what I've heard. Three papers, she gives heavy feedback on all to improve. On the first one, she lets you resubmit an edited version with a lot of feedback/revisions. Essays are based on one book you read that's easy to understand and on her lectures. She's straightforward and is really enthusiastic/passionate.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Stay away from this class. He's a nice guy but his tests are extremely unfair — VERY complicated, multi-step problems but gave NO partial credit — even a missed negative sign would result in no credit given. Lowest grade I've gotten at ND by FAR.

Terrible professor. Terrible grader. Terrible everything. Never helpful at office hours (only on zoom btw) and has the most difficult exams out of any ACMS course. Can't think of any good thing to say about him. Would never take again and I would recommend he never teach this class again. Notre dame, figure it out
rating_tags: Tough grader--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Quite possibly the worst professor. Never available outside class except on Zoom on Friday mornings at 9am. Never would do in person office hours. Exams are tough. No practice exam is given. Doesn't try to help you prepare for the exams other than the easiest 10 review problems you have ever seen. Takes weeks to grade midterms. Would not take again

Absolutely amazing professor, I had him for Intro to International Development Studies. Very easy grader, and lectures are extremely engaging. He selected a lot of guest lecturers too, which was fun. The readings can get heavy, but you'll learn a ton.

Very caring for his students. No homework except for reading and coming up with 1-2 discussion questions each class. We had 2 essays to write throughout the entire semester (each 4-5 pages), and one final essay (6-10 pages). Easy grader with essays. Participation matters a lot! Super kind and really passionate about what he does. Highly recommend!

Zhao isn't great at explaining more complex concepts and was hard to reach outside of class. The actual course didn't need to be that hard but he made it difficult to engage and really understand material, I wouldn't suggest taking his class.

The best professor at Notre Dame, period. Her personality is so bubbly and fun, she teaches incredibly well with highly engaging lectures, she genuinely cares about her students, and creates such a positive environment to learn about Armenian Literature. Seriously, if you have the chance, take any of her classes – it's worth it.

Do the readings before the exams and you're golden. I didn't participate, did ~50% of the readings before class, wrote good essays, did all mandatory assignments (there's optional ones), never went to office hours, and did a one-day cram for both exams. I almost got an A. He's a smart dude and understands it's an intro Philo; not a hard class.

Put a lot of effort into the class and still ended with an A-. I participated, wrote good essays, did every assignment, went to office hours frequently, and studied for exams. I would definitely say this was a difficult class with good students receiving less than stellar grades, but if you absolutely have to take, it isn't the end of the world

Dr. Fromm is the absolute sweetest! Film and the Physician is my fav course I've taken at ND. I learned so much from Dr. Fromm. The only work is a few papers, most of which are short, and that's it. We watch movies in class and discuss medical topics. A great course for pre-med students that fulfills CCIM requirements. Highly recommend Dr. Fromm!!

Hidden Gem in Mendoza! Very funny and quirky which makes lectures entertaining. Homework is pretty light. Definitely study for tests as they are majority of your grade. You can substitute midterm with your final in case you bomb one though. I didn't think exams were that difficult though. Would totally recommend.
Awesome teacher, don't have to go to class and extremely nice/approachable. Take the class over Mcgavaro if you can!

Prof. Prizant is a beautiful, wonderful person. Easily one of my favorite people at Notre Dame, if not the world. She's a fabulous role model for women because of her strength, confidence, and beauty. It may seem like she's a bit of a feminist sometimes, but it just makes you have that much more respect for her. Funny and interesting, too.
Rough class. Rambles about random calculations that will never help you in the class.
I love Professor West! The assignments are interesting and relevant. Class discussions are fun & he is always available when help is needed.
Extremely experienced in the industry and very knowledgeable. Class was not very difficult, group project is a lot of work though.
Professor Aspesi was absolutely amazing. The class wasn't super difficult but it was very insightful. The only thing you need is a Bible. She posts any additional readings on Sakai.

Hill really wants you to learn. He focuses on applications of knowledge (uses lots of graphing, Microsoft Excel to solve problems, etc.). If you make a mistake on a test, you will get a lot of points off, but he is fair if you ask for a regrade. I learned a lot, but I will not get too high of a grade.
Cares ddeply about students; good lectures; challenging and interesting!
Super accommodating, and always very gracious! Wonderful professor for creative writing and/or literature--gives great feedback on papers or manuscripts. 10/10 would take any class she taught.
most fashionably dressed professor in the physics dept

I had Prof. Cangany for a history seminar on Puritans. Despite the boring topic choice, she was a great professor. She tried her best to make the material more engaging and was focused more on developing our writing abilities than knowledge on the Puritans. She makes you submit rough drafts but will really work with you to rewrite them.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Taji has done a good job of focusing more on examples to help us learn than focusing solely on theory. Sometimes he skips steps without explaining what he did, but he is always willing to answer questions. He has lots of office hours, especially before tests or quizzes. He also has a funny sense of humor and will roast student when it is deserved.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: One of the biggest humanitarians I have known. I liked his class and he was open to student suggestion and cared about the student's success.

If you can't take Bartolini, I would avoid Snider when looking for other EG10117 teachers. EG10117 is pedantically graded across sections, but Snider grades especially harsh and has rigid preferences.

He is tenured so doesn't really care about student feedback.Also has a confusing sense of humor consisting of sarcasm toward non-EE and being snarky

Funny guy - not a bad option for EG10117. Easy grader as well - he won't take off points for dumb things and it's very possible to do extremely well on essays in his class if you follow the rubric requirements. Not very good at Excel which is a big part of the beginning of the class, but you don't need him to be.
This queen really is a real gem. She is subtly funny. The only thing is she talks really quickly, but she is willing to repeat herself many times if needed.
I took Ceramics II with Bill, and I felt like he was good at figuring out when to step in and offer help and when to let us figure it out ourselves.

He was my professor for Moreau. Sweet man, but the class was silent pretty much. This was just an awkward class because he asked us for participation but a select few rarely responded. Still I aced it. Show up and pass pretty much.

The difficulty of Calc III is constant no matter who teaches it. He does make it bearable and he's quite sweet. With that said, I did fall asleep during some lectures. But he's a very cool guy, and probably one of the better options I had.

Even though this is a topical science requirement, the professor makes it way harder than it should be. She wanted the grade average to be a B- and very few people got grades they were happy with. Lectures were so long and one-dimensional, but you have to go to them because you are allowed 2 skips. Tests had trick questions and tons of reading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: No Comments

Prof. Stapleton is one of the best professors I have had in college. She is extremely caring, engaging, and funny during class. She is very straight-forward about what you need to know on exams. Her grading scale for papers can be a bit confusing, but she provides a lot of comments that will easily help boost your grade. Cannot recommend her enough

Absolutely amazing professor, you'll come out of every class having learned so much. That being said, she is a hard grader and is sometimes arbitrary with scores. Extremely kind and accessible, her class makes your day feel better
This class was very useful for thesis writers. Professor Buckles really helped keep me on track and was very clear on her expectations.
rating_tags: Respected--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: Ochem is notoriously tough, but Melander made it ten times harder. Very unorganized notes; I ended up going to Jim Parise's lectures even though I was not enrolled in his course. Take anyone else for orgo 1 if you can (besides maybe Helquist). This class is hard enough, and so a good teacher can make or break it. He unfortunately was not good.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: 3 take home exams + in person final. he's a smart dude but not good at explaining for ppl who have never taken stats. his chapter packets are gold. he drops the lowest exam score. if you know stats you're fine, but if it's brand new... good luck.

prof tweed is the best. such a nice guy and genuinely makes lectures so interesting. hard grader when it comes to papers, but you only write one or two. fair amount of reading for each class but you can kind of pick and choose which ones seem interesting to you. only need a 250ish word journal for each class

Very nice, and clearly passionate about the material. However, her course has little structure and she doesn't really teach anything. Lots of useless homework and incredibly boring lectures. Soft-spoken and hard to hear at times. Easy class, but one you'll have to suffer through.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: He was a nice person and offered extra credit. He had us do homework in groups, which helped to make sure no one fell behind. His lectures were sometimes hard to follow.

Professor Holt grades participation strangely. I spoke every class, and raised my hand often but he would choose the same students to speak in class. He would interrupt me in the middle of a thought. I initially received a B+ for participation which was reduced to a B- at the end of the semester despite an increase in participation.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: She is very knowledgeable, and cares about your learning. The entire class is in German, and it might feel like a big jump from Intermediate I, but you will come out of this class feeling very confident in your skills. She sometimes forgets to post homework / quizzes, but they are not too hard. 2 presentations, 2 essays, and a term project.

She loves to teach and help. Overall, the class is graded by 5/6 projects that you work on in class, but I found myself spending a couple hours outside of class time working in the studio to complete. She is very understanding and will change deadlines and is open to any suggestions you may have. A couple long lectures but a good class overall.

Dr Liu was awesome! I learned a lot. She covered not only how to perform Bayesian analysis and computation but also why. I highly recommend her class.  I usually don't rate my professors here, but I accidentally learned about a rating of 1 and don't think it represents Dr Liu's teaching. I could easily find another student who rates her class 5/5.

Prof. Kraus gives clear lectures to explain the readings and is good at clarifying points of confusion. Most of her assignments are short papers on key concepts. Her exams are pretty straightforward. This class was a good foundation for understanding the history of philosophy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: She is a fantastic art teacher. She is extremely helpful and will never lower grades from lack of talent. If you genuinely try, follow instructions, and complete assignments, you will almost definitely get an A.

I really loved Father Haake. He was very compassionate and I could tell he loves teaching. His grading was always fair and he was extremely accessible outside of class for anything I needed. There was lots of challenging reading which got a bit much towards the end of the semester but nothing unmanageable. A real gem.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of the smartest professors at Notre Dame. He is the type of professor you should want at a school of this prestige; not an easy class at all, but the educational value from Professor Matthies is top-tier. Also goes above-and-beyond in effort for his students; he once gave me a three-paragraph explanation for a simple email question.

If you'd like to take a class all about her rather than the subject matter, take her class. She rambles about herself while grading harshly with zero feedback. She also ignores emails, has vague grading criteria, and is the most mundane lecturer I've ever had. And for the final essay, she hid the average on Canvas so we couldn't see how low it was.

The content was INCREDIBLY difficult, but Professor Kolda gave great lectures and was extremely helpful outside of classes (office hours is CRITICAL to success), so this course was fascinating and he is one of my favorite professors. He gave helpful study guides as well and you always knew what was expected for tests (plus there's a hefty curve).
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. Dhaliwal is the nicest person and deserves all the flowers. The material was challenging, but he didn't mind revisiting topics in class or talking more outside of class. We had the option of taking quizzes or taking a final exam. He was open to adjusting readings if most of the class was having a particularly stressful/heavy week.

Dr. Morris is one of the most difficult and disrespectful professors I have ever had. Expect to get out of class late every time and for him to yell at you during weekly meetings. Other than his disagreeability, the class is very easy and a cool experience. Great class, awful professor. His poor attitude does not make the immense workload worth it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I loved prof Kola! I took her USEM on medical racism and she made the class so fascinating! There were readings before every class, but they're honestly entertaining so don't worry. She isn't necessarily an easy grader, but she gives great feedback so you'll learn how to do well. Dr Kola truly wants everyone to succeed and I appreciated that!

I have never disliked a professor or teacher to this degree and I actively will never take a class with her again (to the point where I would rather not graduate if it meant that I had to have her as a professor again). The little constructive criticism she gives is helpful, but the rest is borderline bullying and super frustrating.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Online Savvy

comment: Somanchi is one of my favorite professors at Notre Dame. Attendance wasn't strictly mandatory but showing up to class was necessary for learning the material. Throughout the lectures there were many practice questions to keep students engaged, and collaboration is encouraged. He truly cares about student learning and jokes around in class.

Not much to say. She is a very good Intro to Photography professor. I learned a lot and it was not that much work. A few big projects but not stressful and a nice break from my other work. Would highly recommend

Good guy, pretty funny. Clearly knows what he is talking about, but lectures can be somewhat abstract / highly theoretical, which can be hard to put into practice. Always available outside class to help.

Wojcik is clearly passionate about the course content. She treats it as if she's learning along with us rather than just talking at us. I enjoyed the papers because of the freedom to pick which films to write about. Some films were great and some were boring. I learned a lot from this class and would recommend it for an interesting art credit.

Prof. Coleman's dynamic teaching style and diverse discussions make the course engaging and intellectually stimulating. She adeptly communicates complex ideas and turns each class into an enriching journey. Essays can be tough but just make sure to carefully read the rubric, otherwise, I highly recommend Prof. Coleman and this course!

Professor Mainwaring was super sweet and engaging. Her classes were always fun, even though the readings were a bit long. I would absolutely take her again. She is also extremely knowledgeable and well-prepared.
The whole class grade is based off of two 6 page papers, not too difficult, I never read for the class because they were research papers

Terrific teacher and really makes sure you thoroughly understand the content. Puts an emphasis on participation to keep you engaged but if you raise your hand once a class you'll get full credit. Grade is 2 midterms, a final, a case, and then homework and participation which is basically free points. Got a B- in MD1 but an A in MD2 bc of him

Prof. Mittelstaedt is a fine professor and you likely won't have a choice whether to take him or not because it seems that he has monopolized M&DII these days. He wrote the textbook so if you are looking for an alternative explanation to topics, you are out of luck. The best part of his teaching is he very thoroughly explains every problem.

Prof. Hunyh is one of the best and kindest teachers I have had! She is extremely understanding but also facilitates activities that helped me learn the material. Class is never boring because we move around a lot and get to know our classmates! Projects are very interesting and promote creativity. Asian American Experience is a great class!

One of the best professors I've ever had and a great facilitator for class discussion. She presented class topics in a digestible fashion despite their serious nature. She had an encouraging attitude to student perspectives & reflections. Her class was not heavy work-wise. It was very manageable. Amazing person, incredibly understanding and kind.

Gave clear and comprehensive pre-lab lectures and encouraged participation.  Has a very prominent accent, but it does not really hinder understandability.  Would walk around during lab and was always happy to help and patient in responding to questions or problems.  Hope for good TAs, they do all the grading and determine your final grade.
Admittedly, it is a hard class to have to teach, but she really didn't do a great job at it. Pretty boring, but that might just go with the territory.

Professor Reifenberg is a great professor. International Development in Practice is a group-based course, so your overall satisfaction with the course will be heavily dependent on the other students you are paired with. He can be a little overbearing and stubborn at times, but overall, the course is excellent. You'll also learn to love Paul Farmer!

Dr. Behrens is a good professor and knows what he is talking about . He provides clear instructions and grading guidelines for assignments that tell you exactly what needs to be done. He expects you to work hard, so as long as you show effort and engage with the material, you will do well.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Professor Solomonescu is the best English professor I've had at Notre Dame! She is the only teacher here to have genuinely made me a better writer. Her interest in the content and her students is infectious and she genuinely wants you to learn and succeed. She is a hard grader and relies heavily on participation in discussions, but I LOVE her!

Professor Thomas is the most caring prof I've had at Notre Dame. She genuinely wants her students to succeed and is very approachable. Submit your work on time and you will get a good grade. While some students think of having to take W&R as a negative, I was glad I didn't have AP credit because I got to take Prof Thomas's class.

Professor Russo is the best theology professor! He is a great lecturer! He does require students to have a specific bible that you do need! You write no papers the entire semester, but his class is VERY reading-heavy. He does assign pop quizzes based on the readings! But he gives you the format of your exams and the questions!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Beware of pop quizzes

comment: i literally cannot express to you enough how amazing russo is. NO PAPERS during the semester. The only textbook u need is the bible (a specific one, wait to see which one in syllabus), he literally tells you what is going to be on tests (like literal questions), he is so nice, and you actually learn stuff. bro is an absolute legend

Professor Kim was a joy to have as a professor, she knows a lot about her subject and is super passionate which makes learning really easy. She is a super talented lecturer and she is super nice! Definitely recommend taking this class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Took her class for a intro in creative writing. Genuine good person, and is relatively new to her job since she is only a graduate student. Her passion and care for her craft is obvious in each class, and gives you a great grade if you put in effort. Genuinely enjoyed the readings and writings of the calss.

His lectures are kind of boring. There are quizzes after each class where you have to answer if you were in class or not (he typically notices if you lie). 2 problem sets, 2 short projects based on a paper, 3 exams. First exam was multiple choice, T/F, and short answer. Second and final were multiple choice, T/F, and long answer you get before hand
confusing explanation
This professor helped me get a job after graduation and prepared me to keep it.
Super helpful!  Presents clearly with great examples from when he worked as an accountant.

Coach Gaal is seriously such a great person. I had her for Contemporary Topics. I've talked to her a bit outside of class and she's so down to earth and incredibly selfless. I could not recommend her highly enough!

Generally a bad teacher. He is in bad shape, so he has no right to be teaching a gym class. Class is stupid(we ran around a track holding hands, how is that going to help me get more fit in any way?), and he seems unprepared to do anything but flex his ego about being a gym teacher. Should lose lots of weight before teaching about fitness/health.

Summary: He is one of the worst professoradviser you will see at University of Notre Dame.  He is unwilling and incapable of mentoring. As a graduate student in his group, the years in grad school are just miserable. He stochastically reply student's emails at a very low probability.  All he cares is grant money.  Students are cheap labors.

He is very talkative and will talk for the entire class. Every class requires paragraph-length discussion question based on a fairly lengthy reading. Over the course of the class we basically read the whole bible. There are no tests but he requires a 4 page paper on previous reading due every other week.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: She is an expert on Kant. She is intelligent and knows the information, but can get too philisophical at times.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Dr. Sullivan is without a doubt the best professor I have had at Notre Dame. He is a great lecturer who is so passionate about the material that it makes every class period interesting. He's not an easy teacher by any means with frequent reading and written homework, but he will make sure that you learn the material. Would advise anyone to take him
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Amazing lectures

comment: Do what you can to take her classes. It is formatted to make you succeed and do well. Everything is very manageable and doesn't try to get you tripped up on anything or make anything confusing.
Busy work - interesting guy tho,
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Lousy professor. Puts no preparation into class.

The Science and Strategy of Nuclear War was an interesting class in concept, but ended up being very in-depth on some random international relations elements with some sporadic rushed basic physics and chemistry. Bardayan seemed nice but not much interaction and TA did all grading. Tests were hard but easy points with daily take home quizzes.

Don't take The Science and Strategy of Nuclear War, especially if not a science major. It's like taking history, war strategy, physics, and chemistry in one. Little to no feedback. Physics explanations are rushed. Physics is graded by a TA who is not in class and is barely contactable. There is one singular office hour per week and it's around noon

Kristi is very intelligent and thoroughly knows the material that she teaches. She has a kind heart and provides helpful feedback. However, she reminds me of my parents with the way that none of my work seemed to be good enough for her. I've never struggled with a class to the extent that I did with hers. Be prepared to work hard!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Gives good feedback

comment: I had Misiolek for Elements of Calc.  While he is not terrible, he is not a great prof by any means either.  He is very thorough during the initial weeks of class, when pre-algebra concepts are covered, but once the calc kicks in, he teaches very abstractly.  Lectures are dull and not very inspiring.  Three midterms plus a final

This is the first year he's teaching 10117 because he moved from senior design to freshman. He is an extremely harsh grader and seems like he expects the same quality work from freshmen as seniors. If you want an easy A (like engineering design is supposed to be) don't take his class.

Prof. Prygoski made Static Mechanics easy to pass with a good grade, including getting points back on exams, homework being a large portion of the grade, and being very accessible through email or office hours. If you put in any work at all, it's impossible to get below a B. I also learned a lot in her class, and quite liked her lectures.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: Though he is a graduate student, he has been my best calculus professor so far. He is very sweet and charming during lectures, while still explaining the concepts really well. He even told us when we did not have to pay attention to certain concepts. Calculus II is tough by itself, but he really helped out. He also replies to emails really fast.

Brian is a wonderful professor! He really cares about giving unique assignments and is always available outside of class. He gives great feedback too! There can be a lot of reading and some quizzes, but the information is good to know. Overall, great professor and a really fun course!

This Theo class is the most work intensive class that I have taken at ND. You get long long readings every class which you must respond to in the form of reader reflections. These are due every class. I can not stress enough the amount of work this is. He is a swell guy, who gives very solid lectures but the workload is incomprehensible. Be ready!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Rocio is suuuch an awesome professor. Super energetic, caring, and very knowledgeable. She really cares about both her subject and her students, and she put in a lot of work to help us to succeed. Very fair grader, and the readings for the class weren't too heavy.

She really cares about helping everyone. Even though there is a lot of reading, it is truly necessary for the lectures and discussions which are engaging. Draws from a lot of sources and topics. Overall, no exams, only papers or projects.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: Certainly not a blow-off class. Thick readings for every class. Enthusiasm for Irish literature is not helpful but practically necessary to be successful. Really hard--almost impossible, in fact--to get an A. Nice woman but only take her class if you really like medieval Irish and like deep textual analysis
Dan Stowe is a beast. An expert in his field, and he really cares about his students.

Good prof, funny and engaging even though the class is at 8am. One exam and it's the open note final so make sure to take notes. Weekly homework assignments are playing video games and reading 10-20 pages and writing a 1-3 pages. Attendance is big so don't be late or skip

Fantastic lecturer and very enthusiastic. There are occasional in-class quizzes, several assignments (problem sets and projects), and the exams are not difficult. Reading the textbook is not necessary. He does not record the lectures.

He is such an amazing guy and truly cares about the students' learning. He appreciates everyone's input but as someone who doesn't really understand ecology well, it was a very difficult class. Prepare to write full on essays during exams because they are LONG

Prof. Meyer started the first class with a heartfelt speech about what it means to be in community with one another at Notre Dame and how he will always be there for you as his student. His lectures are very helpful and he's really funny/lively. He is incredibly caring and always available outside of class. Highly recommend him for any acct. course
Very inspirational, wordly, retains from political statements often faced in econ.
Very good at explaining complex subjects, made herself available to students outside class time, lectures are a bit dry but content is very interesting
Great professor, super interesting and easy sustainability 1 credit. Would suggest anyone take this class for fun or to fulfill minor requirements.

I found him condescending a lot of the times when students asked questions in class or in office hours. He also moves through the slides very quickly and gets annoyed if you ask what was on a previous slide because he went too fast. Overall just not enjoyable.

Tends to move very quickly through slides that have a lot of information on them, which is unideal for people who like to take clear notes. I found the lectures a little boring, but he is definitely very available outside class and got to know students that went to his office hours.

The absolute sweetest man. He is flexible with grading and super understanding of his students. Lectures tended to be kind of boring, but you can tell he really loves the subject and wants people to succeed

Prof. Bugyis is so kind and passionate about what he teaches. The class is discussion based, so make sure to read a little of the readings so you have something to talk about. He is very understanding and flexible. I learned so much in this class and I thought the readings were very enjoyable.

Not too much homework, she assigns readings, but you can get through without reading them. I earned a solid grade in this class based on the couple writing assignments and I thought she graded easy. However, I heard my classmates received worse grades and they all seemed to have at least 1 low graded essay. I'm planning on taking her in the future.
Very unclear expectations, very rude to students, and does not allow for any academic discourse over methods of musical performance and composition.

Prof. Jaros is a genius and he does his best to engage students through discussion and participation in class. His grading is a little hard but his assignments are always broad to let you talk about what interests you specifically. He also seems to care personally about his students/their lives and is accessible outside of class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: A recently returning faculty member, Prof. Bremyer is new to the university but not the tri-campus community. Her class requires that you are thoughtfully engaging with the texts she assigns and are participating with others and offering your thoughts. While at times the readings can be a bit long, make sure to read them.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: He has great notes and uploads them to allow you to print them out and follow along. Funny guy too

I had Harms for BPS, so the instructor doesn't matter very much. However, Harms gave long, boring lectures about how to work with a team at the start of the semester. He was a nice guy though. It was just tough to sit through those boring lectures during the first three weeks.
Great lecturer. Genius.  This is the only professor I've had who I can say actually inspires awe.

Prof Fuzesi is so knowledgeable! I highly recommend her classes in the London program. She is a very nice grader, so as long as you keep up with the readings, you should do well in the class. It can be a lot of work, but the classes are definitely manageable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Prof Tebbit is great! He is very sweet and the assignments are not very difficult. He also makes an effort to make class interesting by having multiple student breakouts during the class. The readings are not very long/difficult, and I would highly recommend staying on top of them. I would 100% take Tebbit again!

Jacob Lehman is a Grad Student that teaches Drawing I. I took drawing I with very little artistic talent because I needed a fifth class, and I absolutely loved it. The class is very low stress and there is plenty of time to complete each project. Jacob gives sufficient feedback and is really nice and supportive.

Very passionate about the subject and does a good job at explaining concepts. The workload is light with one homework assignment a week and only ten total. These are easy points as homework is completion and they double as great study material. Exams are manageable as you are given two front and back cheat sheets in addition to a formula sheet.

Prof. Fusezi is a really enthusiastic teacher and she truly cares a lot about political science. She can be cold and strict at times, but she's a pretty easy grader and if you come to her with any concerns she is very open to helping you.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Zambrana is a great guy. He has so much energy and brings a lot of life to the lectures. Unfortunately, the material sucks. He has you do three fairly intensive group projects and the second test and the final are extremely hard. I did very poorly in the class and somehow ended up with a B+, but the material is hard.

Professor Coppedge was not my favorite professor. He is a nice guy but awkward and not great at socializing. He is sometimes too brilliant and struggles to explain difficult concepts in ways that the class can understand. I will say that I did learn how to use the basics of Stata in his course. The class wasn't awful, but I didn't really enjoy it.

Prof. Joshua is extremely caring and passionate about the material in her Gothic Short Stories USEM. There is no textbook but read the provided stories closely, as she is big on discussion and participation. She can be a strict essay grader, but if you go to office hours before the essay she will help you workshop. Overall, amazing Prof!

Really great professor overall, usually does not assign lots of homework. Likes to get to know his students and is understanding. Take any of his classes if you don't mind participating, you will not regret.

Dr. Vachon is a great teacher who truly cares about each student and their enjoyment of the class. While his lectures can be long, read the textbook and engage with the material. The class will be a great learning experience and will contribute to future courses that align with this topic!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Vachon is so amazing. He is so passionate about his work and caring towards his students. His lectures can be a little bit long sometimes, but for the most part, class is very interactive and he uses a lot of aids to make lectures more enjoyable. Online quizzes every week, a few reflections, one research paper, and oral final

Prof. Fulcher Dawson is a great professor! She really facilitated my interest in the topic and every class was engaging since we did different activities every time. Assignments for me took a while because they required a lot of research, but I learned a lot by doing each of them. Great class for learning about policy!
Very clear lectures and assignments. Her expectations and grading were very reasonable. She really made me care about the material and got students to engage with the educational community.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: Great guy, cares about his students learning. The lectures can be a little boring at times given the nature of the class, but he tries to be engaging. The exams are not terrible, and the quizzes are not too hard as well. There is one big group project with a presentation, but he is not a harsh grader.
Decent teacher, was offended that he demanded to be called professor despite being a grad student.

Christiano is a very sweet guy. He clearly cares about all of his students and their wellbeing. His lectures were often boring and difficult to follow. His grading was quite strange and he often gave not much of an explanation for essay grades. On plus side, he cancelled class some times and was flexible with deadlines. Easier profs for intro soc.
rating_tags: So many papers--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Concepts of Energy and Environment is very boring. Some of the subject matter can be interesting, but the lectures drone on and on. Pair that with the fact that there are no tests and participation doesn't matter, this creates a very skippable class. But if you're looking for an easy science class, this isn't the worst option.
Great professor, terrible class. Really cared to make sure students were giving their best effort. Adjusted class to fit the knowledge base and needs of students. Friendly and dedicated to his work.

Paul Levan is amazing! Very humorous but knowledgeable professor! Taught the course very well and introduced Mathematica in a way that made sense. His lectures were humorous & make you want to come to class. Gives plenty of time for turning in assignments. He gives concept checks, two projects, two exams, preview assignments, and Edfinity homework.

I took him for Moreau and he was pretty chill and easy. Make sure to try to participate and engage in class. His class is not boring at all and he makes it pretty interesting. He's also a pretty chill grader and is understanding about submitting assignments late.

I took him for Intro to Hispanic Lit and Cultures and he was honestly very chill and easy! Most of the assignments are graded based on completion he tries to help students understand the readings, especially the confusing ones. Highly recommend!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Gives good feedback

comment: strict on attendance, she's an easy grader but the class content was hard

I took intro to probability with Karp, and he was a great professor. The topics in first half were quite easy but the second half was tough and interesting, especially the stuff on convolutions and continuous random vectors. Shies away from calculus, preferring cool tricks to solve problems. A bit robotic but is somehow charming at the same time.

Professor Karp is a rare kind of professor and one you should absolutely take if you get the chance. He understands students incredibly well and shapes his class in order to cover content in the way that makes the most sense while finding strategies that work for everyone. You will never be left behind in his class, and he's always accessible.

Had for Intro to Linear Algebra and ODE. Terrible lecturer; he spoke quietly, wrote sloppily, wrote small, and didn't have great example. He was the course coordinator this semester, and it was terrible. The tests were always impossible to do well on and there was no other way to do well in the class. The textbook was also terrible.

Had Yvette for Moreau, very chill and caring professor.  Always concerned for the well-being of her students, even started every class with "roses & thorns."  Easy grader, never left any feedback, curious if she actually read my responses.  Overall an enjoyable professor and class.

Professoressa Marcantonio is a great professor. She made me like taking Italian. Her grading was harsh enough to require me to study without being punitive or causing too much stress. She is great and if you have the opportunity to take her class, do it!

Would recommend for anyone taking intermediate 2. She made a difficult course very manageable, and was super understanding about language learning. Allows you to earn points back on in class exams, which is amazing. Participate in class, but don't be worried about making mistakes.
Nice person. She was a little intimidating to me, and her exams are much harder than my experience with other Spanish teachers at ND.

This theo 2 is really applicable to every day life and I learned a lot about myself from the materials. Professor Mattison is great. He is very caring and very approachable. There is a decent amount of reading and you have to do a small assignment before every class but it's usually only 100 words. The two essays were fun to write too!

He is the nicest person you will meet. It is easy to get an A-, nearly impossible to get an A unless you are ready to put in the work, which you should be if you in the architecture program at Notre Dame.

Incredibly good introduction to Architecture at Notre Dame. Do not be afraid to ask questions and learn technique from him. He will try his best to make sure that he is giving you all the pointers he can. DO NOT BE DISCOURAGED by low grades early on. Like any architecture course at ND, you will spend several hours in studio outside of class.

her notes are so organized & she is so sweet. she has a thick accent so sometimes it is hard to tell what she is saying, but she goes through the notes so well and makes it clear what she is trying to convey. but calc A is HARD so take calc 1...missing one question on a test can rly drop your grade. This isnt her fault, its just a departmental prob

She makes you do so much busy work for no reason. Made the class so boring, even more than you would already expect it to be. The tests were ridiculous, composed of multiple parts including many memorizations where you had to know every aspect of about 20 paintings plus an essay. There were also multiple long essays throughout the year

Super passionate + made me enjoy learning! Hard to take notes coz fast-paced (posts after class). Emphasis on participation (voluntary). One homework OR small proj /week. Interesting reading + show assignments (e.g. Netflix). She uses Google Drive instead of Canvas (hard to determine grade). Exams + final not hard to study for at all (no quizzes).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lecture heavy

comment: Richter's lectures are decent, but the homework is much harder than what's covered in class. Richter also gets very upset when students use online resources on homework yet provides no alternatives to use yourself. Additionally, he doesn't share overall or final exam grades, leaving students guessing their performance on the 30%-weighted final.

It was an awful professor. He could not teach and assumed that we understood everything he said. He would yap a lot so we'd had to fly through the materials because we did not have enough time. He was also really condescending, arrogant, mean, passive aggressive, making the class a bad environment. Please do not take him if you have other options.

Prof Richter is a very great man. Very passionate about the subject matter and super good lecturer. The only thing that is bringing his rating down is the difficulty of the homework and exams. Despite that, he's always willing to help answer any questions or discuss interests.

Professor Shoup did an amazing job in organizing the class to follow the ND Curriculum, while making hw assignments easier than other Theo Classes. Lectures were very informative and he does go by pretty fast but if you take good notes and ask for help, his class should be a light A  (2 Midterm Exams and a Final). He also gives good study guides.

Homework every class with a decent amount of reading, but he doesn't grade harshly. Exams consist of a short and long essay plus some multiple choice. Very friendly and willing to talk about anything, and he's passionate about what he does. However, if you're unfamiliar with theology/didn't go to a Catholic school, he's not the best at the basics.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Lots of homework

comment: While attendance is required, Professor Yadav is very accommodating and wants his students to succeed. He is always available to meet during his office hours and will change them to fit your schedule too. Sometimes it is hard to comprehend the fully in Spanish lectures but as long as you keep up with VHL, you will be fine.

I took Prof Yadav for Beg. Spanish II and he was great! Expected to be on time for class, majority of the class was lecture (mostly in Spanish) with breaks for group work. Quizzes and exams were pretty straightforward, he would review in class or give you a review to complete. Always accommodated office hours to your schedule. Totally recommend!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: This course is a 'choose your own grade' course. Basically, it is extremely easy to get an A. The professor is very chill, and if you need to miss a class you can with no penalty and you can always get an extension. There is a lot of busy work, but none of it is very hard. There were 2 papers and a project, all of which were easy.

For reference, I very much struggled with DiffEQ 1, and was bound to struggle with DiffEQ 2. Professor Wensing is an incredibly intelligent person, but he is still able to communicate complex info to students very effectively. He is incredibly caring and motivated me to do better in this class. I do not think I could have passed without his support
Professor Mullins was fantastic. I am not very religious but I was thoroughly interested in his class. The course load was manageable and communicated very explicitly for test preparation.

Yin Laoshi is my favorite teacher I have ever had. She is hilarious and great at teaching as she has had many years of teaching. She took time at the beginning of every class to ask how our week/weekends went and consistently made us feel welcomed and show she truly cared about our wellbeing outside of the classroom. Everyone loves her!
Really nice and fun professor, new at Notre Dame. There are readings for every class but the discussions are interesting and engaging.

She is an awesome educator who is truly considerate and caring. The course is really interesting and you always come out of the classroom feeling like you have learned a lot. Professor Kim is also accessible and provides great feedback when needed. The tasks are just challenging enough to make you reflect and progress so I definitely recommend her!

This class (intro to Theology) was much harder than it had to be. The quizzes required extensive studying of lecture notes. The essays were long and required a lot of time. Nonetheless, it was Teghas first year teaching and hes passionate about the material. Was a fun class most of the time.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: Quizzes & tests were almost impossible to study for unless you had access to his slides which he conveniently sped through in class (some were literally shown for 2 seconds). Insane amounts of reading for each class day posted impulsively 1-2 nights before with about 10% useful information requiring a lot of writing. Nice about deadlines though
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Lil bro does not realize we are taking other classes. Fr. Tegha will assign homework the night before it is due, where it is due in the middle of the day, and give us 20+ pages of dense reading each night. His blackboard is highly disorganized: I sent a picture to my friend and he thought it was a math lecture. Do not take Tegha, take father Kevin.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: This class has a lot of homework. The readings are pretty long and can be confusing. He can be a bit all over the place in his lectures but they come back together. I really enjoyed taking his class, he is very knowledgeable and makes class engaging and fun. He genuinely cares that we learn about theology, making it more interesting.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Caring

comment: I loved Dr. B. Super kind and passionate about subject. The course wasn't difficult. You really only have to skim the readings to do well on the reading responses, because otherwise they are super long. Would recommend for sure.

It was a super interesting course, and professor respected differing opinions. Quite easy class with few assignments, but that could hurt your grade if you do bad on 1 thing (main grades were a quiz, final paper, & 2-3 other assignments). Not a boring philo course AT ALL. Very likeable, interesting, funny guy and i would 100% take him again!

You think this is the easiest class of your life until you don't learn anything and get graded harshly for no reason (when you've literally learned nothing and it's not your fault). I don't know a single person that got an A. He's a young professor and doesn't quite know what he's doing yet, and his grading is very inconsistent.

Lectures are boring and use no technological aids. The class does not have a Canvas page; all work was submitted via email. Mr. Fernandez-Armesto also often questioned my intelligence, saying things such as "Your writing is unintelligible" or "I don't think you have a learning disability; you're just a terrible writer." Don't take his class

I took his Humans & Other Apes course. No tests, many short readings/excerpts, write a two page summary and analysis on a reading of your choice (~6 total with extremely clear guidelines), final research paper, final exam is take home and questions are like the summaries. If you can handle a VERY BORING class, you'll be fine.
